Sean Garloise.Text: If you have an Explorers Captain, this Crew gains +1 Adventuring. If you have a Sea Dogs Captain, this Crew gains +1 Swashbuckling. When tacking to produce Influence to hire a Crew aligned to your Captain’s faction, this Crew produces 2 extra Influence if there is at least one card in play with the word “Beer”, “Rum” or “Wine” in its title.
Sean Garloise.Flavor Text: He’d served with the Sea Dogs for years and when he told his captain he was shipping with the Explorers, Berek gave him a jeweled dagger to remember the good times.

Sean McCorley.Name: Sean McCorley
Sean McCorley.Flavor Text: Don' take it so seriously, lad. We all gonna die someday. It ain't the when that matters... it's the how.

Sean McCorley - Exp..Name: Sean McCorley - Exp.
Sean McCorley - Exp..Text: If Sean inflicts Hits with a Boarding Attack, all of your Boarding Attacks which occur later during the Boarding inflict 2 extra hits.

Sebastiano Scogna.Name: Sebastiano Scogna
Sebastiano Scogna.Text:
Sebastiano may only use Ships with no faction symbol.
Act: Once per turn, if you are in a Sea with a Port attached, target one of your  Item or Goods Attachments.  If you have 3 or more unaligned Crew with an  Influence cost greater than 2, sink the Attachment to draw 2 cards.

Second Chance.Name: Second Chance
Second Chance.Text: React: Play when you are paying an Adventuring cost. If you are in a Sea to which you have a Port attached, Second Chance produces 3 Adventuring.
Second Chance.Flavor Text: "The Montaigne have attacked and we need every hand we can get. You may be a criminal, senor, but I'm betting you're a patriot as well."

Secret of the Winds.Name: Secret of the Winds
Secret of the Winds.Text:
You must be in the Mirror to play this card. Any player in the Mirror may discard this card by producing 14 Adventuring as an action.
React: Tack this card when another Ship attempts a Boarding with your Ship. The Boarding attempt is canceled.
Act: Tack this card to get a Control card from your deck, show it to your opponents, and put it in your hand. Shuffle your deck.

Secret Stash.Name: Secret Stash
Secret Stash.Text:
Any player in this Sea may sink this card by tacking 3 Swashbuckling as an action.
React: Sink Secret Stash when paying an Adventuring cost to produce 3 Adventuring.
Secret Stash.Flavor Text: "Jack's got himself a secret horde somewhere. If only we could read his map..."

Secrets of the Tops.Name: Secrets of the Tops
Secrets of the Tops.Text: React: Play when tacking a Topman to produce Sailing. That Crew produces extra Sailing equal to your Ship's move cost.
Secrets of the Tops.Flavor Text: "He's the only topsman who hasn't broken a bone tryin' that stunt."

Seduction.Name: Seduction
Seduction.Text: Act: Tack and discard one of your non-Captain Crew to target a non-Captain Crew in the same Sea as your Ship. If the target's Crew Influence cost is less than your Crew's Influence cost the target Crew is tacked ands may not untack or use any abilities until the untack phase of next turn. Sophia's Daughter crew need only tack or be discarded (not both) to use this effect.
Seduction.Flavor Text: "Finish your beer, lover. My evening's just beggining..."

Seize the Reins.Name: Seize the Reins
Seize the Reins.Text:
The Influence cost of this card is reduced to 0 if you have a Rilasciare Captain.
React: Play instead of performing a Boarding Attack. Target a Ship Attachment attached to the other Ship in the Boarding. The ship's controller must either sink the target attachment or suffer 6 Hits.
React: Play instead of performing a Boarding Attack. Target one action card in play to sink that action card.
Seize the Reins.Flavor Text: That sallow little lawyer is the future of Montaigne.

Seizing La Boca.Name: Seizing La Boca
Seizing La Boca.Cost: May only be completed in La Boca. 7 Can. and then suffer 2 Hits.
Seizing La Boca.Trait: 1 Sea Away - Prize - Unique - La Boca Attachment - Control
Seizing La Boca.Text: Your Captain has +4 Sailing while in La Boca. Any player in La Boca may discard this Attachment by paying 8 Sailing as an action.

Seizing the Forbidden Sea.Name: Seizing the Forbidden Sea
Seizing the Forbidden Sea.Cost: May only be completed in Forbidden Sea. 7 Swa. and then suffer 2 Hits.
Seizing the Forbidden Sea.Trait: 1 Sea Away - Prize - Unique - Forbidden Sea Attachment - Control
Seizing the Forbidden Sea.Text: Your Captain has +4 Influence while in Forbidden Sea. Any player in the Forbidden Sea may discard this Attachment by paying 8 Influence as an action.

Seizing the Frothing Sea.Name: Seizing the Frothing Sea
Seizing the Frothing Sea.Cost: May only be completed in Frothing Sea. 7 Inf. and then suffer 2 Hits.
Seizing the Frothing Sea.Trait: 1 Sea Away - Prize - Unique - Frothing Sea Attachment - Control
Seizing the Frothing Sea.Text: Your Captain has +4 Swashbuckling while in The Mirror. Any player in the Frothing Sea may discard this Attachment by paying 8 Swashbuckling as an action.

Seizing the Mirror.Name: Seizing the Mirror
Seizing the Mirror.Cost: May only be completed in the Mirror. 7 Sai. and then suffer 2 Hits.
Seizing the Mirror.Trait: 1 Sea Away - Prize - Unique - The Mirror Attachment - Control
Seizing the Mirror.Text: Your Captain has +4 Adventuring while in the Mirror. Any player in The Mirror may discard this Attachment by paying 8 Adventuring as an action.

Seizing the Trade Sea.Name: Seizing the Trade Sea
Seizing the Trade Sea.Cost: May only be completed in Trade Sea. 7 Adv. and then suffer 2 Hits.
Seizing the Trade Sea.Trait: 1 Sea Away - Prize - Unique - Trade Sea Attachment - Control
Seizing the Trade Sea.Text: Your Captain has +4 Cannon while in the Trade Sea. Any player in the Trade Sea may discard this Attachment by paying 8 Cannon as an action.

Señor Ladrón.Name: Señor Ladrón
Señor Ladrón.Text: React: Tack this card when you are paying the skill cost for an Item Attachment or the completion cost of an Item Adventure to reduce the cost by 3 (minimum 0).
Señor Ladrón.Flavor Text: "I don't know how Allende trained him, or why he found the name so funny." - Delaina Darling
Señor Ladrón.Changes on MRP: Trait modified;Text modified;Flavor text modified;Artist modified;

Señor Ladron, Second Mate.Name: Señor Ladron, Second Mate
Señor Ladron, Second Mate.Text:
The cost of this card is reduced to 0 if the card: "Senor Ladron" is attached to your Captain. Sink "Senor Ladron" when this Crew enters play. You may not attach "Senor Ladron". This Crew does not count against your Crew maximum.
React: Once per turn, immediatly after this Crew tacks to produce Adventuring for an Item Adventure, discard a card from your hand to untack this Crew.

Sergeant Benitez.Name: Sergeant Benitez
Sergeant Benitez.Text: React: Tack one of your Skeletal Crew when suffering Hits to reduce the number of Hits by 1.
Sergeant Benitez.Flavor Text: "I think he lost it in the war, but it's not like we can ask him."
Sergeant Benitez.Errata: May use his ability to have a skeletal crew absorb hits in the 7th Sea.

Sergei Nyasvy.Name: Sergei Nyasvy
Sergei Nyasvy.Text: If a Crew is not pushed forward to oppose this Crew when he is pushed forward to start a Boarding Attack, he inflicts 3 extra Hits with the Boaridng Attack.
Sergei Nyasvy.Flavor Text: "But where are you going? Come, let us wrestle, and then I shall feast on your bones!"

Set Adrift.Name: Set Adrift
Set Adrift.Text: React: Play before you perform an action. Target another player's Ship with at least one Damage Attachment attached. Move the target Ship to an adjacent Sea.
Set Adrift.Flavor Text: "I made a deal, Celedoine," Bonnie called as she rowed away. "Keep the crew safe. Be a good captain. Live er die, my story's done... and where I'm goin' ye can't follow."

Settling the Matter.Name: Settling the Matter
Settling the Matter.Text: React: Tack this card and target and untack the tacked Crew on the other Ship with the highest Infeuence Cost, to untack this Crew.

Seven League Striders.Name: Seven League Striders
Seven League Striders.Flavor Text: I saw him leapin' from one ship to the other, sailin' like a bird in flight... An' I thought all bards did was tell stories.

Seven-Color Sam.Name: Seven-Color Sam
Seven-Color Sam.Text: Sam may not be placed on a Villainous Captain's Ship. Sam has +2 Swashbuckling while there is a Villainous Captain in play.
Seven-Color Sam.Flavor Text: "Seven generations of sailors have worn these smocks, an' each one's added a new strand. I haven't decided what color mine'll be just yet."

Shadow.Name: Shadow
Shadow.Text: This Crew may not attach Nacht Knacks while tacked.

Shala.Name: Shala
Shala.Text: Act: Discard one of your Crew to draw one card. This can be done once per turn.
Shala.Flavor Text: One day, Shala knew, Theus would finish with Kheired-Din and then he would be hers at last.

Shala - Exp..Name: Shala - Exp.
Shala - Exp..Text: React: Once per turn, when you are producing Influence, you may sink one of your Corsairs Crew to produce 2 Influence.
Shala - Exp..Flavor Text: Kheired-Din could barely be contained after the escape. Only Shala's gentle words kept him from butchering the entire crew.

Sharing a Cot.Name: Sharing a Cot
Sharing a Cot.Text: This Crew counts as one less toward your Ship's Crew maximum (minimum 0).
Sharing a Cot.Flavor Text: "Every night,  I wake up screaming when his long yellow toenails dig into my shin."

Sharp Maneuvering.Name: Sharp Maneuvering
Sharp Maneuvering.Text: Target another Ship in this Sea. Until the end of this turn, your Cannon Attacks targeting that Ship each inflict 2 extra Hits if your Ship has a lower move cost.
Sharp Maneuvering.Flavor Text: "Tell Harry we're swingin' round again! I want them bleeding from every side!" - Jeremiah Berek

Sharp Shooter.Name: Sharp Shooter
Sharp Shooter.Text: React: Play immediately after a Crew with Swashbuckling less than 3 tacks to absorb Hits from a Boarding Attack. Target and sink that Crew.
Sharp Shooter.Flavor Text: "Just a little closer, lad, and I'll blast your... Hey, that guy owes me money!"

Shellbacks.Name: Shellbacks
Shellbacks.Flavor Text: "Soft me lads! This cove has claimed better men than us."

Shieldmen.Name: Shieldmen
Shieldmen.Text:
When this Crew tacks or sinks to absorb hits, they absorb one extra hit.
React: When you are paying Adventuring to complete an Adventure with an initial cost of 5 or more, discard a card from your hand to produce 1 Adventuring. Use this ability once per Adventure you are completing.
Shieldmen.Flavor Text: “Get behind me, sir. This looks dangerous.”

Shining Example.Name: Shining Example
Shining Example.Text: React: Play when tacking a Crew with the First Mate trait to produce skill points. That Crew produces 3 extra skill points.
Shining Example.Flavor Text: Every captain needs a strong right hand man.

Ship's Boat.Name: Ship's Boat
Ship's Boat.Text:
The Ship's Boat counts as one Crew against your crew maximum.
React: Tack this card immediately after you have completed an Adventure. Untack one of your Crew which tacked to pay the Adventuring cost of that Adventure.
Ship's Boat.Flavor Text: "It was just a wave. Keep rowing."

Ship's Brig.Name: Ship's Brig
Ship's Brig.Text: React: Tack Ship's Brig when another player is targeting one of your Villainous Crew. Cancel the effects of the action. Tack the targeted Crew if it is untacked.
Ship's Brig.Flavor Text: "You know why I'm in here? Come closer and I'll show you..."

Shore Knowledge.Name: Shore Knowledge
Shore Knowledge.Text: This can only be attached to another player's uncompleted Adventure, and only if you have a Heroic Captain. The  cost to complete this Adventure is reduced by 2 (minimum 0). Once the Adventure is completed, Shore Knowledge attaches to one of your Crew, giving +2 Influence.
Shore Knowledge.Flavor Text: "It's between those coves, McCormick. Trust me."

Shot Across the Bow.Name: Shot Across the Bow
Shot Across the Bow.Text:
You may only play this card if you have a Heroic Captain.
React: Play when you perform a Cannon Attack against a ship. Reduce the Hits inflicted to 0 and attach this card to one of your Crew which produced Cannon. This Attachment gives a +3 Cannon.

Sidhe Sails.Name: Sidhe Sails
Sidhe Sails.Flavor Text: "I don't know how the Captain got those sails from the Sidhe, and I don't want to know, neither. Some things you're just better off not knowing."

Sidhe Storm.Name: Sidhe Storm
Sidhe Storm.Flavor Text: "I don't care what they are. I've got something big enough to tame them..." - Wee Willy

Sidney.Name: Sidney
Sidney.Flavor Text: "Half-breed," Timothy sneered at him. Sidney smiled. "Sometimes, a little is just enough."

Sight 'em Up.Name: Sight 'em Up
Sight 'em Up.Text: React: Discard this card when this Crew is producing Cannon to produce 3 extra Cannon.
Sight 'em Up.Flavor Text: "Morgause can knock the wings off a gull if you give her enough time to aim." - Sebastiano Scogna

Sighted Pistol.Name: Sighted Pistol
Sighted Pistol.Text: This Crew inflicts 2 extra hits during Boarding Attacks.

Sigvaldi Sveinson.Name: Sigvaldi Sveinson
Sigvaldi Sveinson.Text: React: Tack Sigvaldi when you push him forward to start a Boarding Attack. If Sigvaldi inflicts Hits with the Boarding Attack, he inflicts 3 extra Hits.

Silver Earring.Name: Silver Earring
Silver Earring.Flavor Text: "Espera used to tell me that it gleamed like the fire in his heart. So I broke his leg." - Dalia

Singing Sal.Name: Singing Sal
Singing Sal.Text: Sal has +2 Sailing if there is a Chantey in play.
Singing Sal.Flavor Text: "There's a running bet to see who kills him first - Edahgo or the others rowers." - Shala

Sinking of the Swan.Name: Sinking of the Swan
Sinking of the Swan.Flavor Text: "YOU tell the Empereur the ship cannot sail if it is made of gold. I already upset him this morning, and I haven't even talked to him yet."

Skeletal Boarding Gang.Name: Skeletal Boarding Gang
Skeletal Boarding Gang.Text: When this card sinks to absorb Hits during a Boarding, it absorbs 1 extra Hit.
Skeletal Boarding Gang.Flavor Text: From Legion's Pit, the Damned have risen...

Skeletal Brutes.Name: Skeletal Brutes
Skeletal Brutes.Text: When this Crew sink to absorb Hits, it absorbs 2 extra Hits.

Skeletal Cannon Crew.Name: Skeletal Cannon Crew
Skeletal Cannon Crew.Flavor Text: The crews that fail have their skulls added to the ammunition pile.

Skeletal Dans.Name: Skeletal Dans
Skeletal Dans.Flavor Text: "Look alive there, boys! Uh... I mean... uh... well... you know what I mean!"

Skeletal Deck Hands.Name: Skeletal Deck Hands
Skeletal Deck Hands.Flavor Text: "Pull, ye lazy bones! Pull, or I'll throw yer ribs to the dogs!"

Skeletal Dregs.Name: Skeletal Dregs
Skeletal Dregs.Text: React: When the Dregs sink to absorb Hits, discard a card from your hand to place the Dregs in your hand instead of the discard pile.

Skeletal Marketeers.Name: Skeletal Marketeers
Skeletal Marketeers.Flavor Text: They can eat cannon steel as easily as human flesh…

Skeletal Saboteurs.Name: Skeletal Saboteurs
Skeletal Saboteurs.Text: Act: Tack this Crew to target a Ship Attachment on another Ship in this Sea. Discard this Crew and the Attachment.
Skeletal Saboteurs.Flavor Text: Chiseling knives in bony fists marked another ship the Black Freighter had sent to the bottom.

Skeletal Sail Crew.Name: Skeletal Sail Crew
Skeletal Sail Crew.Flavor Text: On the up side, it doesn't matter if they fall.

Skeletal Shore Gang.Name: Skeletal Shore Gang
Skeletal Shore Gang.Flavor Text: "Soft me lads! This cove has claimed us before."

Skeletal Thugs.Name: Skeletal Thugs
Skeletal Thugs.Text: Skeletal Thugs inflict 1 extra Hit during Boarding Attacks.
Skeletal Thugs.Flavor Text: The first one opened his mouth in a silent moan. The rest shuffled forward slowly, rusty blades hanging from their rotting hands...

Skull Shot.Name: Skull Shot
Skull Shot.Text: React: Play when you perform a Cannon Attack. When Crew tack or sink to absorb Hits from the Attack, they may not absorb more Hits than their Swashbuckling.
Skull Shot.Flavor Text: The sailors screamed like gulls as the unholy cannon shot tore into their flesh.

Slashing Across the Decks.Name: Slashing Across the Decks
Slashing Across the Decks.Text: +2 Swashbuckling. This Crew inflicts 2 extra hits during Boarding Attacks.
Slashing Across the Decks.Flavor Text: "Ha-ha! Dodge-parry-riposte-thrust! Or is it dodge-thrust-riposte-parry? Oh well..."

Slip of the Tongue.Name: Slip of the Tongue
Slip of the Tongue.Text: React: Play when a player tacks a Crew to produce Influence. That Crew produces no Influence. That Crew's controller may pay 2 Cannon to prevent this effect.
Slip of the Tongue.Flavor Text: "Oh...did I say that out loud? I'm terribly...hey, where are you going? Come back!"

Slippery Sal.Name: Slippery Sal
Slippery Sal.Text: Sal counts as two crew against your crew maximum.
Slippery Sal.Flavor Text: "How was I supposed ta know the powder monkeys were down there?"

Slow Tack.Name: Slow Tack
Slow Tack.Text: For the remainder of the turn, all of your Cannon Attacks inflict 1 extra Hit.
Slow Tack.Flavor Text: "They're luffing, the fools. Open fire." - Admiral Orduño

Small Fortress.Name: Small Fortress
Small Fortress.Text:
Any player in this Sea may sink Small Fortress by paying 5 Cannon as an action.
Act: Tack to target a Ship in this Sea. Small Fortress inflicts a 3 Hit Cannon Attack on that Ship.

Snarling Face.Name: Snarling Face
Snarling Face.Text: This Crew inflicts 1 extra Hits during Boarding Attacks (and Duels) and gains the trait: Fear 1.
Snarling Face.Flavor Text: "Matushka's visage can frighten as well as protect."

Sniper.Name: Sniper
Sniper.Text: React: Play immediately after a Crew with 1 Swashbuckling tacks to absorb Hits from a Boarding Attack. That Crew is sunk.
Sniper.Flavor Text: "Nah, we're not sure where the Cap'n got him, but he can shoot the fish out of a seagull's mouth from fifty yards - backwards!"

Snow Leopard.Name: Snow Leopard
Snow Leopard.Text:
A Crew may not have more than 1 copy of Snow Leopard attached.
React: Discard Snow Leopard immediately before you draw cards during a Boarding to untack this Crew.
Snow Leopard.Flavor Text: The snow leopard's keen senses prevent it from ever being suprised.

Soldano Swordsman School.Name: Soldano Swordsman School
Soldano Swordsman School.Text: This Crew absorbs 3 extra Hits when tacking or sinking to absorb Hits during a Boarding.
Soldano Swordsman School.Flavor Text: A rapier in each hand, fully extended. Like a steel whirlwind, it is - nothing but flash and bloodshed.

Solomon Sails.Name: Solomon Sails
Solomon Sails.Text: When Solomon sinks to absorb Hits, he absorbs 4 extra Hits.
Solomon Sails.Flavor Text: "Aye, it's me real name. Me grandfather's name in fact. Ain't it funny how fate works out?"
Solomon Sails.Errata: Text modified: his ability is a Trait, not a React.

Something’s Got to Go.Name: Something’s Got to Go
Something’s Got to Go.Text: Act: Target an Attachment on a Ship with more Crew on board than the Ship’s printed Crew Maximum. That Attachment’s controller must either sink the Attachment or sink an untacked Crew.
Something’s Got to Go.Flavor Text: “Lads, it’s either the rum or me. Hey! Leave me alone!”

Son of a Gun.Name: Son of a Gun
Son of a Gun.Text: React: Play when tacking a Crew to produce Cannon. That Crew produces 2 extra Cannon.

Soner Iqbal.Name: Soner Iqbal
Soner Iqbal.Text: If your Captain is Heroic, this Crew has +1 Influence and -1 Adventuring (minimum 0).
Soner Iqbal.Flavor Text: "Knowledge is dangerous. None understand this more than your 'Invisible College'. Should the Corsairs find some powerful invention or artifcat, I will ensure that they never have a chance to use it."

Sophia's Daughter Membership.Name: Sophia's Daughter Membership
Sophia's Daughter Membership.Text: This Captain gains the Sophia's Daughters affiliation. While you have 3 or more other Sophia's Daughters Crew on board this Captain has the following ability: React: When a Crew in this Sea tacks to produce Influence, tack one of your Sophia's Daughters Crew to reduce the amount of Influence produced by the Influence of the Sophia's Daughters Crew (minimum 0).

Sorcerer's Lament.Name: Sorcerer's Lament
Sorcerer's Lament.Text: Any player may, as an action, sink two of their Sorcery Knacks to sink this Chantey. Sorcery Knacks may not be untacked.
Sorcerer's Lament.Flavor Text: Matushka can take away her gifts as quickly as she gives them out.

Soren \"Painless\" Halstead.Name: Soren "Painless" Halstead
Soren \"Painless\" Halstead.Text: When hiring Soren, you may pay 5 Swashbuckling to reduce his Influence cost to 0.
Soren \"Painless\" Halstead.Flavor Text: "I never hurt my opponents; the death I deliver is clean and quick. Everyone should be so lucky."

Sousdal.Name: Sousdal
Sousdal.Trait: The Mirror Attachment - Unique - Control - Port
Sousdal.Text: You must be in the Mirror to play this card. Any player in the Mirror may discard Sousdal by tacking one of their Crew with Adventuring greater than 6, as an action. When you are in an adjacent Sea, and tacking to pay for a Control card, your Captain produces 3 extra skill points.
Sousdal.Flavor Text: The biggest port on the Mirror and home to the Ussuran Orthodox Church

Southern Trade Route.Name: Southern Trade Route
Southern Trade Route.Text: Move your Ship 2 Seas towards The Mirror (moving through each Sea, one at a time).
Southern Trade Route.Flavor Text: One by one, they followed the currents, each ship seeking the center of the Mirror. Many vessels. Many goals. But only one destination: the Island of the Sunken Eye.

Southern Trade Winds.Name: Southern Trade Winds
Southern Trade Winds.Text: Until the end of the turn, your Ship's Move Cost is reduced by 2 (minimum 1) while you are moving toward the Mirror.
Southern Trade Winds.Flavor Text: "Faster, lads! We'll need more than this if we're gonna get by them Castillian cannons!"

Sparrow Hawk.Name: Sparrow Hawk
Sparrow Hawk.Text: React: Tack this card when another player plays or performs an action that would create a Duel involving one of your Crew. That action is canceled.
Sparrow Hawk.Flavor Text: The sparrow hawk knows when the odds are against it… and can flee to places no foe can reach.

Speak Softly....Name: Speak Softly...
Speak Softly....Text:
You must be in la Boca to play this card.Any player in this Sea may discard this card by producing 12 Sailing as an action. Card effects which discard or sink Sea Attachments may not target this card.
Act: Tack this card to get a Control card from your deck, show it to your opponents and put it in your hand. Shuffle your deck.

Special Gift.Name: Special Gift
Special Gift.Text: Act: Tack Special Gift and target another Ship in this Sea. Inflict 1 Hit to that Ship.
Special Gift.Flavor Text: "I can't say I like using it, but I have sworn to obey the General. My magic awaits his orders."

Spectral Aura.Name: Spectral Aura
Spectral Aura.Text: Any Crew pushed forward to fight against this Crew during a Boarding must tack to do so.
Spectral Aura.Flavor Text: The Eisen tell stories of a mad hermit at the edge of the Undying Swamp. He brings death and disease wherever he goes, and his form glows a spectral, toxic green...

Speed Isn't Everything.Name: Speed Isn't Everything
Speed Isn't Everything.Text: React: Play when you suffer Hits. If your Ship's Move Cost is less than 3, you suffer 3 fewer Hits. You may not play this card during a Boarding.

Speedy Courier.Name: Speedy Courier
Speedy Courier.Text:
Any player in this Sea may discard this card by paying 4 Swashbuckling or Cannon as an action.
Act: Tack this card to attach it to an adjacent Sea.
React: Tack this card when you are paying an Influence cost and this card is not in your Sea to produce 2 Influence.
Speedy Courier.Flavor Text: The Montaigne use Porté mages to keep their fleet informed. As a result, they can coordinate their activites and respond with devastating speed.

Spit in Death's Eye.Name: Spit in Death's Eye
Spit in Death's Eye.Text: You may draw one card immediately before this Crew starts a Boarding Attack.
Spit in Death's Eye.Flavor Text: "Live every moment like it's yer last."

St. Roger's Blessing.Name: St. Roger's Blessing
St. Roger's Blessing.Text: React: Tack this Crew when one of your Crew is sunk. That Crew is placed on the top of your deck, and all Attachments on that Crew are put in the discard pile.

St. Roger's Day.Name: St. Roger's Day
St. Roger's Day.Text: Move your Ship to an adjacent Sea. Beginning with the player on your left, any player may pay 3 Adventuring to cancel this action.
St. Roger's Day.Flavor Text: "Looks after his own, he does. Ain't never been a storm on St. Rogers Day, son. Never been and never will be."

St. Roger's Spyglass.Name: St. Roger's Spyglass
St. Roger's Spyglass.Trait: Crew Attachment - Unique - Item - Glamour 2 Knack
St. Roger's Spyglass.Text: Your Adventures may be placed 1 Sea closer or farther when brought into play (minimum 1 Sea Away).
St. Roger's Spyglass.Flavor Text: "It helps to see, but you have to know what to look for." - Jeremiah Berek

Stand Together.Name: Stand Together
Stand Together.Text:
You may only play this card if you have a non-Villainous Captain.
React: Play when you are suffering Hits to absorb an amount of Hits equal to the number of Loyal Crew you have on board. Sink this card.
Stand Together.Flavor Text: A friendly arm yanked him aside seconds before the cannonball burst through. "Stand together or die alone, eh mi ami?"

Stans (Calm).Name: Stans (Calm)
Stans (Calm).Text: React: Tack Stans when your cards are targeted by a Weather card. Cancel the effects of that card.

Starke.Name: Starke
Starke.Text:
Any player in this Sea may sink this Port by producing 5 Cannon as an Action.
React: Tack this card when another Ship attempts a Boarding with your Ship while you are in this Sea. The Boarding attempt is canceled and the Ship attempting the Boarding suffers 2 Hits.
Starke.Flavor Text: "Margaretta thought  I would find you here, senor."

Staying Ahead of Trouble.Name: Staying Ahead of Trouble
Staying Ahead of Trouble.Flavor Text: Berek had stolen the Cross from the Crimson Rogers - and it was only a matter of time before Reis caught up with him.

Steady Leak.Name: Steady Leak
Steady Leak.Text: React: Play this card when you are suffering Hits to absorb 9 Hits. This card attaches to your Ship as a Damage Attachment. While this card is attached to your Ship you suffer 1 extra Hit each time you suffer Hits. You may sink this Attachment by tacking 7 Swashbuckling as an action. You may not sink or discard this card with other card effects.

Steal Their Wind.Name: Steal Their Wind
Steal Their Wind.Text: Target another Ship in this Sea. Until the end of this turn, any time that Ship pays Sailing, the cost is increased by 2 Sailing.
Steal Their Wind.Flavor Text: If only our captain's curses could've filled the sails.
Steal Their Wind.Changes on MRP: Boarding Attack modified;Trait modified;Text modified;Flavor text modified;

Stealing the Falcon's Roost.Name: Stealing the Falcon's Roost
Stealing the Falcon's Roost.Text: When this card enters play, sink all Ship Attachments attached to your Ship, including all Damage Attachments. Your crew maximum is modified to a 9 and your Ship's Move Cost is modified to a 3 while this card is attached.
Stealing the Falcon's Roost.Flavor Text: "Forgive me, senor, but we have need of your ship." - Jeremiah Berek

Steel Earring.Name: Steel Earring
Steel Earring.Flavor Text: " I made it from the piece uv a wrecked forty-pounder.  It whispers in me ear, an' tells me where ta aim"

Steering Clear.Name: Steering Clear
Steering Clear.Text: React: Play when an opponent starts Boarding your Ship. This Boarding is canceled. The other player may pay 2 Sailing to cancel this action.
Steering Clear.Flavor Text: As he sailed away, Berek's men yelled insults at the Castillian navy ships - who found themselves empty-handed yet again.

Stench.Name: Stench
Stench.Text: When this Crew is pushed forward in a Boarding Attack or an opposing Crew is pushed forward to oppose this Crew, the opposing Crew has its Swashbuckling reduced by 3 until the end of the Boarding Attack (minimum 1)
Stench.Flavor Text: The only thing they could hear was a hideous wet tearing sound as he slowly scraped himself across the deck.

Sterk (Wholeness).Name: Sterk (Wholeness)
Sterk (Wholeness).Text: React: Discard this card when you suffer Hits. You suffer 3 fewer Hits.

Stirring Speech.Name: Stirring Speech
Stirring Speech.Text: Tack a Holy Crew or a First Mate Crew to untack one of your other Crew, except your Captain.
Stirring Speech.Flavor Text: "A better man would have something to say to you today, boys. But me, all I's got to say is this: Every man who's standin' by me side when we're done tonight will have more gold than any one man can carry."

Stolen Documents.Name: Stolen Documents
Stolen Documents.Trait: 1 Sea Away - Illegal - Item - Crew Attachment
Stolen Documents.Flavor Text: "He's got so many, he won't miss one or two..."

Stolen Guns.Name: Stolen Guns
Stolen Guns.Trait: 2 Seas Away - Goods Adventure - Crew Attachment
Stolen Guns.Flavor Text: They ain't stolen, they be salvage! The ship we got 'em from was sinkin'!

Stolen Sword.Name: Stolen Sword
Stolen Sword.Trait: 2 Seas Away - Illegal - Item - Crew Attachment
Stolen Sword.Text: +1 Swashbuckling. This Crew inflicts 2 extra hits during Boarding Attacks.

Storms Make Sailors.Name: Storms Make Sailors
Storms Make Sailors.Text: +1 Swashbuckling. This Crew inflicts 1 extra Hit during Boarding Attacks.
Storms Make Sailors.Flavor Text: "Storms make men and break boys." - Sailor Proverb

Strange Skies.Name: Strange Skies
Strange Skies.Text:
The move cost of the Strange Skies may not be increased.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

Strange Skies - Foil.Name: Strange Skies - Foil
Strange Skies - Foil.Text:
The move cost of the Strange Skies may not be increased.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

Strength isn't Everything.Name: Strength isn't Everything
Strength isn't Everything.Text: +1 Swashbuckling. This Crew inflicts 3 extra Hits during Boarding Attacks.
Strength isn't Everything.Flavor Text: "Find out where he got that vest. It belonged to Amanda." - Guy McCormick

Strength of Destiny.Name: Strength of Destiny
Strength of Destiny.Text: React: Tack this Crew after another player has targeted your ship with an action that resulted in a Cannon Attack to cancel that action and inflict 2 Hits on that Ship.
Strength of Destiny.Flavor Text: "If you just look at it right, you can reach out and seize the sun itself."
Strength of Destiny.Artist: Luis del Vazquez de Barcino del Castillo

Stronghold of La Bucca.Name: Stronghold of La Bucca
Stronghold of La Bucca.Text:
The cost of this card is reduced by 2 if you have a Brotherhood Captain. Any player in this Sea may sink this Attachment by paying 7 Cannon as an action. Captive Crew in this Sea are considered to not have the Captive and No attachments traits.
Act: Tack this card and one of your Crew while in this Sea to target another Ship in this Sea. Inflict 4 a Hit Cannon Attack on the target Ship.

Styrke (Strength).Name: Styrke (Strength)
Styrke (Strength).Text: While this card is in play, this Crew inflicts 2 extra Hits during Boarding Attacks.
Styrke (Strength).Flavor Text: "Shall I pluck your limbs off like a fly?"

Succubus.Name: Succubus
Succubus.Text: Target all Porté cards in play. Tack those cards.
Succubus.Flavor Text: "Never open your eyes when you're crossing through the Portal. Thre's things in there who don't like being seen." - Timothy le Beau

Surprise Rescue.Name: Surprise Rescue
Surprise Rescue.Text: The Sailing cost to attempt a Boarding is reduced by 2 (minimum 1).
Surprise Rescue.Flavor Text: The General and his crew sprang upon the execution scene, freeing Orduño from the flaming pyre and fleeing through the same Porté hole by which they had come.

Svein Hegge Hjermstad.Name: Svein Hegge Hjermstad
Svein Hegge Hjermstad.Text: Act: Tack Svein to target a Ship in this Sea. Sink the top card of your deck and the top card of the target's deck.
Svein Hegge Hjermstad.Flavor Text: Another Vesten turncoat, he cannot leave Kirk except under heavy guard.

Swelling Tides.Name: Swelling Tides
Swelling Tides.Text: Target a Ship in this Sea. Tack the target.
Swelling Tides.Flavor Text: What the sea wants, the sea will take.

Swift Vengeance.Name: Swift Vengeance
Swift Vengeance.Text:
You must be in the Mirror to play this card.Any player in this Sea may discard this card by producing 12 Adventuring as an action. Card effects which discard or sink Sea Attachments may not target this card.
Act: Tack this card to get a Control card from your deck, show it to your opponents and put it in your hand. Shuffle your deck.

Swimming with Sharks.Name: Swimming with Sharks
Swimming with Sharks.Text: React: Play when an opponent begins a Boarding with your Ship that you do not cancel. Target and sink a Crew on the other Ship with an Influence cost less than 2.
Swimming with Sharks.Flavor Text: "Keep swimmin', Morty! Ye got that guppy on the run!"

Swing from the Rigging.Name: Swing from the Rigging
Swing from the Rigging.Text: React: Play when you are paying the Sailing cost to begin a Boarding. Tack one of your Crew to produce Sailing equal to that Crew's Swashbuckling.
Swing from the Rigging.Flavor Text: "Anyone who doesn't think the breach can be crossed hasn't seen Manuel Dejavez."

Swivel Gun.Name: Swivel Gun
Swivel Gun.Text:
Act: Tack Swivel Gun and target another Ship in this Sea to inflict a 1 Hit Cannon Attack on the target Ship.
React: Tack Swivel Gun when paying a Cannon cost to produce 1 Cannon.
Swivel Gun.Flavor Text: Castillian ingenuity provided the deadliest weapons to defend their shores.

Swiveling Cannon.Name: Swiveling Cannon
Swiveling Cannon.Flavor Text: "Catillian ingenuity is responsible for more deaths than the white plague."

Sylvia Étalon du Toille.Name: Sylvia Étalon du Toille
Sylvia Étalon du Toille.Text: Sylvia may attach cards as if she were Montaigne. When Sylvia comes into play, you may search your deck for a card with the title: "Montaigne Puzzle Sword" and attach it to Sylvia at no cost.
Sylvia Étalon du Toille.Flavor Text: "The Freighter has destroyed threee Montaigne villages. If Gosse knows how to stop it, then my sword will be here to aid him."

Syrneth Barometer.Name: Syrneth Barometer
Syrneth Barometer.Trait: 1 Sea Away - Artifact - Unique - Ship Attachment
Syrneth Barometer.Text: React: Tack this card when you are paying for a Weather card to produce 3 skill points towards the cost of that card.
Syrneth Barometer.Flavor Text: "I'd trust Galecatcher's nose before that whirlygig." - Sean McCorley

Syrneth Crystal Eye.Name: Syrneth Crystal Eye
Syrneth Crystal Eye.Text: React: Play when you suffer Hits. You suffer 1 fewer Hit, and this card attaches to your Captain. This Attachment has the Eye trait, and gives a +1 Influence. A Crew may not have more than one Eye Attachment.
Syrneth Crystal Eye.Flavor Text: "Don't look too close, lad. The last man who did... well, I don't wanna see it twice."
Syrneth Crystal Eye.Changes on MRP: Cost; sepcial cost/Cancel cost modified;Boarding Attack modified;Text modified;

Syrneth Dagger.Name: Syrneth Dagger
Syrneth Dagger.Text: React: Tack this Crew when he is fighting in a Boarding attack to reverse any type of Boarding Attack played by the other player. Choose Club, Dagger, Punch, Slash or Thrust. This Crew returns an attack of the choosen type, and inflicts 2 extra Hits  if they inflcit Hits during this Boarding Attack.

Syrneth Guardians.Name: Syrneth Guardians
Syrneth Guardians.Text: Target another player who has 2 or more uncompleted Artifact Adventures in play. Sink all of the cards in that player's hand.
Syrneth Guardians.Flavor Text: "I'm not going in there. YOU go in there..."

Syrneth Lock.Name: Syrneth Lock
Syrneth Lock.Text: React: Play before another player produces any skill points to complete an Adventure. That player may not use any Attachments to produce skill points to complete that Adventure, until the end of the turn. Any skill points needed to complete that Adventure during this turn must come from tacking Crew.

Syrneth Navigator.Name: Syrneth Navigator
Syrneth Navigator.Text: React: Tack this Crew when another player performs a React which cancels one of your Actions that will result in a Boarding. Cancel the React.

Syrneth Powder.Name: Syrneth Powder
Syrneth Powder.Trait: Unique - 2 Seas Away - Artifact - Ship Attachment
Syrneth Powder.Text: All of your Cannon Attacks inflict 2 extra Hits.

Syrneth Ship.Name: Syrneth Ship
Syrneth Ship.Text:
Your Crew Maximum may not be increased. Your Captain's Starting Wealth is reduced by 2.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.
Syrneth Ship.Flavor Text: For the first time in millennia, it sails again.

Syrneth Tiller.Name: Syrneth Tiller
Syrneth Tiller.Text: Act: Sink Syrneth Tiller to move your Ship to an adjacent Sea.
Syrneth Tiller.Flavor Text: "The Syrneth harnessed the currents for us. It would be a shame to waste their gift." - Guy McCormick

Tagging.Name: Tagging
Tagging.Text: React: Play when a player tacks a Crew to pay Swashbuckling cost. That Crew produces no Swashbuckling (This may not prevent a Crew from absorbing Hits or from inflicting Hits during Boarding). That Crew's controller may pay 2 Influence to cancel this action.

Taking El Toro Rojo.Name: Taking El Toro Rojo
Taking El Toro Rojo.Trait: 2 Seas Away - Prize - Unique - Captain Attachment
Taking El Toro Rojo.Text: +1 Swashbuckling. Your Loyal Crew have +1 Swashbuckling.
Taking El Toro Rojo.Flavor Text: "It's a lovely ship. I promise to bring it right back."
Taking El Toro Rojo.Changes on MRP: Cost; sepcial cost/Cancel cost modified;Trait modified;Text modified;Artist modified;

Taking from the Rich.Name: Taking from the Rich
Taking from the Rich.Text: Any attachment in play that produces Influence, produces 3 less Influence (minimum 0). This does not effect Attachments that provide a bonus to an Influence skill.
Taking from the Rich.Flavor Text: "They call me the Raven." She leveled the pistol at his head. "You can call me your armed robber du jour."

Taking the Hit.Name: Taking the Hit
Taking the Hit.Text: React: Play when you are suffering Hits. Each Crew that tacks to absorb Hits absorbs 1 extra Hit.
Taking the Hit.Flavor Text: "Watch, my friends. Watch and see how a Castillian dies." - Enrique Orduño

Talia del Emelia.Name: Talia del Emelia
Talia del Emelia.Text: When hiring Talia, you may pay an additional 3 Influence to give her the trait: Fate 1 and +2 Sailing until the end of the game.
Talia del Emelia.Flavor Text: "I don't look at the threads anymore. They scare me."

Tar, Tar, and More Tar.Name: Tar, Tar, and More Tar
Tar, Tar, and More Tar.Text: React: Play when you are suffering Hits. If your Ship is the only Ship in this Sea, you suffer 4 fewer Hits.
Tar, Tar, and More Tar.Flavor Text: "Just keep the fire out of the powder room and we'll be fine." - Grimey Stubbs

Tarsis the Mad.Name: Tarsis the Mad
Tarsis the Mad.Text:
React: Tack Tarsis when you are attaching Kheired-Din's Secret instead of paying the Adventuring cost of Kheired-Din's Secret.
React: Tack Tarsis when you are about to suffer Hits from Kheired-Din's Secret. Reduce the Hits suffered by three (minimum 0).
Tarsis the Mad.Flavor Text: "Bear left, and throw the meat overboard now!"

Tear their Sails.Name: Tear their Sails
Tear their Sails.Text: React: Play this card instead of performing a Boarding Attack to attach this card to the opposing, target Ship as a Damage Attachment. While attached, the Ship's player draws 1 fewer card after each round of a Boarding (minimum 1). Any player in this Sea may sink this card by paying 3 Swashbuckling as an Action. This card may not be sunk or discarded with other card effects.

Tempting the Portal.Name: Tempting the Portal
Tempting the Portal.Text: Act: Discard this card and tack this Crew to discard the top card of your deck. If the Boarding Attack on the discard is a Dagger, sink this Crew. Otherwise, untack your Captain.

Ten Barrels Bob.Name: Ten Barrels Bob
Ten Barrels Bob.Text: React: Tack this Crew instead of performing a Boarding Attack to target a Crew on the other Ship in the Boarding with an Influence cost equal to or less than the number of completed Adventures attached to this Crew. Target Crew is discarded.

The Island.Name: The  Island
The Island.Text: Any player may sink this Chantey by tacking their Captain as an Action. Players may not play Chanteys.
The Island.Flavor Text: Imperatrice Morella cried in horro as the threads converged before her. "The  Island!" she shrieked. "The 7th Sea will consume us!"

The Battle of San Cristobal.Name: The Battle of San Cristobal
The Battle of San Cristobal.Text: +3 Cannon and this Crew gains the Gunner trait. You may not attach this card to your Captain.
The Battle of San Cristobal.Flavor Text: "Not for the Church, my love," Margaretta whispered, "but for the people of San Cristobal… "Open fire on the Prédateur! This battle ends now!"

The Betrayal of Allende.Name: The Betrayal of Allende
The Betrayal of Allende.Text: React: Play before performing an action. Target a Crew on another Ship in this Sea. Tack all Attachments attached to that Crew.
The Betrayal of Allende.Flavor Text: Allende tensed as the Witches surrounded him. "Alesio...?!" "I'm... sorry Captain," Alesio sobbed. "It was foretold..."

The Better Part of Valor.Name: The Better Part of Valor
The Better Part of Valor.Text: React: Play when an action card targets one of your cards. That action is canceled. Sink this card.
The Better Part of Valor.Flavor Text: "He who fights and runs away, get his arse kicked twice as hard the next time we meet." - The General

The Black Dawn.Name: The Black Dawn
The Black Dawn.Text:
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.
React: Tack when suffering Hits to absorb 2 Hits.

The Black Dawn - Foil.Name: The Black Dawn - Foil
The Black Dawn - Foil.Text:
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.
React: Tack when suffering Hits to absorb 2 Hits.

The Black Freighter.Name: The Black Freighter
The Black Freighter.Text:
Act: Once per turn, you may get a Skeletal Crew from your discard pile and put it on top of your deck.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Black Freighter - Foil.Name: The Black Freighter - Foil
The Black Freighter - Foil.Text:
Act: Once per turn you may take one Skeletal Crew from your discard pile, and put it on top of your deck.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Black Freighter's Folly.Name: The Black Freighter's Folly
The Black Freighter's Folly.Text:
Act: Target a Ship in this Sea with a tacked Black Freighter Captain on board. Inflict 4 Hits on that Ship.
Act: Tack one of your Crew to draw 1 card from your Deck.
The Black Freighter's Folly.Flavor Text: "Thomas was the last, you butcher," Gosse whispered. "By all that's holy, I swear Thomas was the last."

The Black Glove.Name: The Black Glove
The Black Glove.Trait: 1 Sea Away - Hand - Kreuzritter Crew Attachment
The Black Glove.Text: +1 Swashbuckling. All of this Crew's Punch and Club Boarding Attacks are changed to be a Dagger. Reacts may not be played in reaction to Hits inflicted by this Crew during Boarding Attacks.

The Bloat.Name: The Bloat
The Bloat.Text: Act: Sink this Crew to target a Ship in this Sea. Inflict 3 Hits on that Ship.
The Bloat.Flavor Text: Two years on the bottom filled him with water. It's only a matter of time before he bursts.

The Bonita Swordsman School.Name: The Bonita Swordsman School
The Bonita Swordsman School.Text:
The cost of this card is reduced by 3 if being attached to an Invisible College Crew. This Crew absorbs 3 extra Hits when tacking to absorb Hits.
React: Tack this card to reverse any type of Boarding Attack. This card produces a Slash Boarding attack.
The Bonita Swordsman School.Flavor Text: It was developed for defense solely - quite effective as long as you don't want to hit back.

The Burning of the Capital.Name: The Burning of the Capital
The Burning of the Capital.Text: Any player in this Sea may sink this card by paying 8 Adventuring as an action. Adventures may not be placed in this Sea, and cards may not be attached to this Sea while this card is in play.
The Burning of the Capital.Flavor Text: "Again," Valoix commanded. "I want l'Empereur himself to see the smoke in Charouse."

The Calloways.Name: The Calloways
The Calloways.Text: React: Tack immediately after you have put an Artifact Adventure into play. Move your Ship 1 Sea closer to the Adventure.
The Calloways.Flavor Text: Vincent and Rose were both born on an Explorer ship, they met on a Explorer ship, got married on a Explorer ship and they'll probably die on a Explorer ship.

The Calloways - Exp..Name: The Calloways - Exp.
The Calloways - Exp..Text: The Calloways have +2 Swashbuckling while you are the Defender in a Boarding.
The Calloways - Exp..Flavor Text: "Pull, Piotr! On the count of three…"

The Captain's Word.Name: The Captain's Word
The Captain's Word.Text: You may only play this card if you have a Heroic Captain. Discard three cards from your hand to name a skill. All of your Crew gain +1 to that skill until the end of the turn. You only have to discard one card if you have a Gosse Captain.
The Captain's Word.Flavor Text: "My riches are yours," Gosse intoned. "After all, this may be my last chance to spend them."

The Code.Name: The Code
The Code.Trait: Corsairs Captain Attachment - Letter of Marque - Unique
The Code.Text:
You must tack your Captain to put this card into play.
React: Tack the Code and one of your Crew when you are paying a Sailing cost. That Crew produces Sailing equal to your Ship's move cost.
The Code.Flavor Text: "The Second Prophet is your master now." - Kheired-Din

The Coming Tempest.Name: The Coming Tempest
The Coming Tempest.Text: Any player may sink this Chantey by paying 7 Sailing as an action. All Captains have the following ability: React: When another player performs an effect to cancel one of your actions that will result in a Boarding, tack one of your completed Adventures to cancel that effect.
The Coming Tempest.Flavor Text: "McGee channeled powerful forces in her quest to destroy Reis. Too powerful, some say." - Derwyddon

The Corsair's Folly.Name: The Corsair's Folly
The Corsair's Folly.Text:
Act: Target a Ship in this Sea with a tacked Corsairs Captain on board. Inflict 4 hits on that Ship.
Act: Tack one of your Crew to draw 1 card from your Deck.
The Corsair's Folly.Flavor Text: Kheirid-Din ordered other Corsair vessels to scour the seas for his wayward pilot. Ernesto made them regret it.

The Crimson Roger.Name: The Crimson Roger
The Crimson Roger.Text:
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.
React: Tack when you tack a Crew to produce Cannon. That Crew produces 2 extra Cannon.

The Crimson Roger - Foil.Name: The Crimson Roger - Foil
The Crimson Roger - Foil.Text:
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.
React: Tack when you tack a Crew to produce Cannon. That Crew produces 2 extra Cannon.

The Crow's Nest.Name: The Crow's Nest
The Crow's Nest.Text: You must discard this card when you suffer Hits from a Weather card. Other players may not perform reacts which react to your ship entering their Sea.
The Crow's Nest.Flavor Text: "It shakes in the wind like a tree. You get used to it - or you take a one way trip to the deck, whichever."

The Curse.Name: The Curse
The Curse.Trait: Black Freighter Captain Attachment - Letter of Marque - Unique
The Curse.Text:
You must have 2 or more non-Skeletal Crew on your Ship to put The Curse into play.
Act: Tack this card to move your Ship one Sea Closer to another player's Ship.

The Destruction of the Spear.Name: The Destruction of the Spear
The Destruction of the Spear.Text: All non-Gosse Ships currently in the Trade Sea have their Move Cost increased by 1 until the end of the turn. Any player in the Trade Sea may cancel this action.
The Destruction of the Spear.Flavor Text: "Destroy it," Gosse whispered, his voice tinged with anger. "Destroy it before Necros uses it to claim someone else I love."

The Discovery.Name: The Discovery
The Discovery.Text:
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.
React: Tack when paying a Sailing cost to produce 3 Sailing.

The Discovery - Foil.Name: The Discovery - Foil
The Discovery - Foil.Text:
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.
React: Tack when paying a Sailing cost to produce 3 Sailing.

The Discovery Attacks.Name: The Discovery Attacks
The Discovery Attacks.Text: React: Play when you are paying Swashbuckling. Tack one of your Ally cards in this Sea to produce 4 Swashbuckling.
The Discovery Attacks.Flavor Text: The Explorers struck as Kheired-Din tried to reach the Final Switch. They had but one goal: the return of their missing crewman.

The Dolphin.Name: The Dolphin
The Dolphin.Text:
You may draw one card before one of your Swordsman Crew starts a Boarding Attack.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Elixir of Life.Name: The Elixir of Life
The Elixir of Life.Cost: Tack one of your Sorcerers with Scry of 1 or more
The Elixir of Life.Trait: 1 Sea Away - Scry 1 Knack - Crew Attachment
The Elixir of Life.Text:
Act: Once per turn, discard another Scry knack attached to this Crew to draw a card.
React: Tack this card and any one of your Crew when you are suffering hits to suffer 4 fewer hits.

The Eternal Grave.Name: The Eternal Grave
The Eternal Grave.Text: React: Sink this card when another player inflicts Hits on your Ship. Reduce the Hits to zero.
The Eternal Grave.Flavor Text: The Freighter shuddered, but the cannonballs did not pierce it. "You'll have to do better than that old man," Necros sneered.

The Explorer's Folly.Name: The Explorer's Folly
The Explorer's Folly.Text:
Act: Target a Ship in this Sea with a tacked Explorer's Captain on board. Inflict 4 hits on that Ship.
Act: Tack one of your Crew to draw 1 card from your Deck.
The Explorer's Folly.Flavor Text: In a flash, McCormick grabbed Maggie and put his sword to her throat. "You mutinous dogs!" he snarled, backing towards Kheired-Din's rowboat. "May you burn in Legion's flames!"

The Falcon's Roost.Name: The Falcon's Roost
The Falcon's Roost.Text:
React: Tack one of your Topman Crew and this Ship when you are being targeted with a Cannon Attack to cancel that Cannon Attack and move your Ship to an adjacent Sea.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Few, the Proud....Name: The Few, the Proud...
The Few, the Proud....Text: React: Play when an opponent begins a Boarding with your Ship that you do not cancel. If their Ship has a higher crew maximum, you may untack 2 of your Crew.
The Few, the Proud....Flavor Text: With jorund's betrayal, the Vendel thought they had Yngvild cornered. They thought wrong.

The Fifth Switch.Name: The Fifth Switch
The Fifth Switch.Trait: Prize - 2 Seas Away - Unique - Item - Captain Attachment
The Fifth Switch.Text: Act: Sink this card. All Ships suffer a number of Hits equal to twice the number of Sea Attachments they control.
The Fifth Switch.Flavor Text: Kidnapped by her own Captain, Maggie had no choice but to do as Kheired-Din commanded.

The Figurehead Released.Name: The Figurehead Released
The Figurehead Released.Text: React: Play instead of performing a Boarding Attack. Tack one of your Crew to target and discard a Ship Attachment attached to the other Ship in the Boarding.
The Figurehead Released.Flavor Text: The undead figureheahd moaned in horror - or was it relief?- as it slid down the prow into the sea. "Do you think that will save you from me?!" Necros howled. "I don't know," Gosse mused. "Let's find out."

The Finest Cannons....Name: The Finest Cannons...
The Finest Cannons....Flavor Text: "These are the finest cannons Vendel money can buy. I don't think your pirate problems will continue much longer."

The Firebird.Name: The Firebird
The Firebird.Text: +4 Swashbuckling. This Crew inflicts 4 extra Hits during Boarding Attacks
The Firebird.Flavor Text: Ernesto called it the Guiding Gem of Hierro. In truth, it was the egg of the lost firebird, a being of infinite majesty and power.Few things on Théah could stand against the Freighter. The firebird, it seemed, was one of them.

The First Switch.Name: The First Switch
The First Switch.Flavor Text: "This is only one, my lord. How can we possibly find them all?" Kheired-Din smiled. "The Prophet will provide."

The Flash Rifle.Name: The Flash Rifle
The Flash Rifle.Text:
The cost of this card is reduce by 3 if being attached to a Rose and Cross Crew. +2 Swashbuckling.
React: Tack instead of performing a Boarding Atack to inflict 3 Hits on the other Ship in the Boarding.
Act: Tack to target and inflict 1 Hit on a Ship in this Sea.
The Flash Rifle.Flavor Text: "It's some infernal Syrneth device that the Knights use. So much for Rose and Cross ethics, eh?"

The Fourth Switch.Name: The Fourth Switch
The Fourth Switch.Text: Act: Sink this card. All Ships not in this Sea must pay their Ship's Move Cost +2 or suffer 5 Hits.
The Fourth Switch.Flavor Text: "Pull, lass! The sooner we turn the trigger, the sooner we can flee this godforsaken island."

The Freighter.Name: The Freighter
The Freighter.Text:
While your Captain is untacked, your Skeletal Crew inflict an additional amount of Hits during Boarding Attacks equal to their printed Swashbuckling.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Freighter's Ashes.Name: The Freighter's Ashes
The Freighter's Ashes.Text:
Act: Name any faction without a Captain in play. Crew with that faction alignement may not enter play until next turn.
Act: Name any secret society. Crew with that secret society affiliation may not enter play until next turn.
Act: Name any nationality. Crew with that nationality may not enter play until next turn.
The Freighter's Ashes.Flavor Text: Call it St Rose's Grave. It's as good a name for the spot as any.

The Fury of the Rogers.Name: The Fury of the Rogers
The Fury of the Rogers.Text: Act: Target another Ship in this Sea. Your Ship begins a Boarding with the target Ship.
The Fury of the Rogers.Flavor Text: The only thing more frightening than the Crimson Rogers was the Crimson Rogers' anger.

The Futility of It All.Name: The Futility of It All
The Futility of It All.Text: React: Play instead of a Boarding Attack. Until the end of the Boarding, non-Captain Crew may not inflict more Hits than their printed Influence cost during a Boarding Attack.
The Futility of It All.Flavor Text: "I havn't had a day off in three years. Sometimes, I wonder why I bother." - torvo Espada

The Gallows.Name: The Gallows
The Gallows.Text: While you have more than 2 completed Adventures in play, your cost to put Sea Attachments into play is reduced by 3 (minimum 1).

The Gallows - Foil.Name: The Gallows - Foil
The Gallows - Foil.Text: While you have more than 2 completed Adventures in play, your cost to put Sea Attachments into play is reduced by 3 (minimum 1).

The Gateway.Name: The Gateway
The Gateway.Text: Your Captain has +1 to all skills while in the the Forbidden Sea and the Mirror. Your Captain has -1 to all skills while in the Trade Sea and the Frothing Sea.
The Gateway.Flavor Text: Kheired-Din held up his hands to block the light. The gateway was here - and the angels beyond called to him for release.

The General.Name: The General
The General.Text: While you have three or more other Montaigne Crew on your Ship, your crew maximum is increased by 2.
The General.Flavor Text: "Captain! What color should we paint the figurehead?" The General broke his nose. "Paint it red."

The General - Foil.Name: The General - Foil
The General - Foil.Text: While you have three or more other Montaigne Crew on your Ship, your crew maximum is increased by 2.
The General - Foil.Flavor Text: "Captain! What color should we paint the figurehead?" The General broke his nose. "Paint it red."

The General's Armor.Name: The General's Armor
The General's Armor.Text: +1 Swashbuckling. This Crew absorbs 1 extra Hit when tacking to absorb Hits.
The General's Armor.Flavor Text: "I left this behind along with my honor," he said. "I used to think they were both a curse. Now I know better."

The General's Fist.Name: The General's Fist
The General's Fist.Trait: Montaigne Captain Attachment - Unique - Signature Item
The General's Fist.Text:
Act: Sink this card to untack your Captain.
Act: Tack this card to target one of your other Montaigne Crew to give that Crew +2 to all of that Crew's skills that are greater than 1.
React: Tack this card when you are paying an Influence cost for an action to play, discard or sink a Control card to give your Captain +4 Influence until after the action.

The General's Plan.Name: The General's Plan
The General's Plan.Text: Act: Target a Sea Attachment in this or an adjacent Sea. Tack the Attachment.
The General's Plan.Flavor Text: The General and his Crew chart a treacherous course up El Rio de Delia, surrounded by Castillian cannon and Montaigne picket lines. At the end of their journey lies the mightiest fortress in Theah... and the execution site of Enrique Orduño.

The General's Tactics.Name: The General's Tactics
The General's Tactics.Text: Target a Ship in an adjacent Sea. Tack one of your Crew to inflict a Cannon Attack equal to that Crew's Cannon skill to the target. The cost to play this card is reduced by 2 if you have a Montaigne Captain.
The General's Tactics.Flavor Text: "Sink them you curs, or by Theus you'll take their place!" - The General

The Great Grey.Name: The Great Grey
The Great Grey.Text: Target any Ship which has 3 or more Adventures in play, but not completed. That ship suffers 5 Hits.
The Great Grey.Flavor Text: You can't stay still too long in the ocean. There's too many things lurking under the waves that can smell a warm body.

The Grey Queen's Price.Name: The Grey Queen's Price
The Grey Queen's Price.Text: Discard this card if at anytime you do not have an uncompleted Adventure in play. The completion cost of your uncompleted Adventures is reduced by 2 (min. 1).
The Grey Queen's Price.Flavor Text: The Queen looked carefully at Bonnie. "The mirror leads to Bryn Bresail, my dear. But to cross it, you must first tell me a secret - something no one else on Théah knows..."

The Guiding Gem of Hierro.Name: The Guiding Gem of Hierro
The Guiding Gem of Hierro.Text:
You must tack your Captain to bring this card into play.
React: Tack this card when you are paying a Sailing cost to produce 2 Sailing.
The Guiding Gem of Hierro.Flavor Text: It came from Ussura originally. Somewhere far to the east. It bore a different name then, but its secrets never changed.
The Guiding Gem of Hierro.Changes on MRP: Trait modified;Text modified;Flavor text modified;Artist modified;

The Gullet.Name: The Gullet
The Gullet.Text: Act: Tack The Gullet and target a Pet in this Sea. Sink the Pet.

The Hanged Man.Name: The Hanged Man
The Hanged Man.Text:
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.
React: Tack when you are paying an Adventuring cost to produce 2 Adventuring.

The Hanged Man - Foil.Name: The Hanged Man - Foil
The Hanged Man - Foil.Text:
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.
React: Tack when you are paying an Adventuring cost to produce 2 Adventuring.

The Heroine of San Cristobal.Name: The Heroine of San Cristobal
The Heroine of San Cristobal.Cost: 8 Adv.; 4 if you have three or more Los Vagos Crew on board
The Heroine of San Cristobal.Text: React: Tack this card after you have put a Control card into play to untack one of your non-Captain Crew that tacked to pay skill points for the Control card.
The Heroine of San Cristobal.Flavor Text: Saving a nation absolves you of many sins.

The Highland Piper.Name: The Highland Piper
The Highland Piper.Text:
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.
React: Tack when you are paying Adventuring to complete an Adventure with the Goods or Item traits to reduce the Adventuring cost of that Adventure by 3 (minimum 0).
The Highland Piper.Artist: Travis Moore and Dærick W. Gröss

The Holy Flag of the Crescent Empire.Name: The Holy Flag of the Crescent Empire
The Holy Flag of the Crescent Empire.Trait: Corsair Ship Attachment - Unique - Item - Jolly Roger
The Holy Flag of the Crescent Empire.Text: React: Tack after one of your Corsairs Crew has been sunk when absorbing Hits inflicted by another player, to target and untack another of your non-Captain Corsairs Crew. You may only use this ability if you have 3 or more Corsairs Crew on board.

The Horror of the Hook.Name: The Horror of the Hook
The Horror of the Hook.Text: Act: Tack this Crew to tack any Crew in this Sea with an Eye, Face, Hand or Leg attachment.
The Horror of the Hook.Flavor Text: Willie screamed in horror as the voices filled his head with a litany of blood. How much more could he take?

The Hurricane.Name: The Hurricane
The Hurricane.Text:
Act: Tack the Hurricane and one of your Crew to draw one card.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Hurricane - Foil.Name: The Hurricane - Foil
The Hurricane - Foil.Text:
Act: Tack the Hurricane and one of your Crew to draw one card.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Inquisition.Name: The Inquisition
The Inquisition.Text:
Any player in this Sea may sink the Inquisition by tacking 4 Cannon as an action.
Act: Target one Villainous Crew in this Sea, except Captains. The target is tacked.
The Inquisition.Flavor Text: "You would rather serve the Church than gain illegal profit. You agree with me, of course. Let's go, then."

The Invictus.Name: The Invictus
The Invictus.Text:
Cannon Attacks targeting The Invictus inflict 1 less Hit (minimum 1).
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Island's Heart.Name: The Island's Heart
The Island's Heart.Text: Act: Tack one of your Crew with Fear 2 or more to play this card. Target an Ally Attachment in this Sea or another player's Ship in this Sea. Attach the target Ally, or move the target Ship, to an adjacent Sea.
The Island's Heart.Flavor Text: Cabora's gateway led to the 7th Sea itself. As Kheired-Din looked on, he could see the silvery waters brimming with lost souls. The sight was so overwhelming that he failed to notice he was no longer alone...

The Jolly Roger of Gosse's Gentlemen.Name: The Jolly Roger of Gosse's Gentlemen
The Jolly Roger of Gosse's Gentlemen.Trait: Gosse Ship Attachment - Unique - Item - Jolly Roger
The Jolly Roger of Gosse's Gentlemen.Text: React: Tack after one of your Gosse Crew has been sunk when absorbing hits inflicted by another player, to target and untack another of your non-Captain Gosse Crew. You may only use this ability if you have 3 or more Gosse Crew on board.
The Jolly Roger of Gosse's Gentlemen.Artist: Mark Jelfo, Brendon Goodyear & Tom Kohler

The Jolly Roger of the Black Freighter.Name: The Jolly Roger of the Black Freighter
The Jolly Roger of the Black Freighter.Trait: Black Freighter Ship Attachment - Unique - Item - Jolly Roger
The Jolly Roger of the Black Freighter.Text: React: Tack after one of your Black Freighter Crew has been sunk when absorbing Hits inflicted by another player, to target and untack another of your non-Captain Black Freighter Crew. You may only use this ability if you have 3 or more Black Freighter Crew on board.

The Jolly Roger of the Crimson Rogers.Name: The Jolly Roger of the Crimson Rogers
The Jolly Roger of the Crimson Rogers.Trait: Crimson Roger Ship Attachment - Unique - Item - Jolly Roger
The Jolly Roger of the Crimson Rogers.Text: React: Tack after one of your Crimson Rogers Crew has been sunk when absorbing Hits inflicted by another player, to target and untack another of your non-Captain Crimson Rogers Crew. You may only use this ability if you have 3 or more Crimson Rogers Crew on board.

The Jolly Roger of the Sea Dogs.Name: The Jolly Roger of the Sea Dogs
The Jolly Roger of the Sea Dogs.Trait: Sea Dog Ship Attachment - Unique - Item - Jolly Roger
The Jolly Roger of the Sea Dogs.Text: React: Tack after one of your Sea Dogs Crew has been sunk when absorbing Hits inflicted by another player, to target and untack another of your non-Captain Sea Dogs Crew. You may only use this ability if you have 3 or more Sea Dogs Crew on board.

The Kire.Name: The Kire
The Kire.Text: When The Kire tacks to aborb Hits, he absorbs 2 extra hits. When The Kire tacks to produce Influence for hiring an Unaligned Crew, he produces 2 extra Influence.

The Kire's Pen.Name: The Kire's Pen
The Kire's Pen.Text: React: Play when another player is putting a Chantey into play. That Chantey does not enter play and is discarded. Any Chantey already in play remains in play.
The Kire's Pen.Flavor Text: "For six months, the Kire has endured this confinement. The Kire's next chapter shall be written in freedom."

The Last Shot.Name: The Last Shot
The Last Shot.Flavor Text: Margaretta watched impassively as Valoix's cannon reduced the cathedral to rubble. "Do something!" the Inquisitor screamed. "Why?" she asked. "Will it bring my husband back?"

The Leviathan.Name: The Leviathan
The Leviathan.Text:
Your Crew have +1 Adventuring while your Captain is untacked.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Living Storm.Name: The Living Storm
The Living Storm.Text: Target any Ship which has 2 or more Adventures in play, but not completed. That ship suffers 3 Hits.
The Living Storm.Flavor Text: The old sailors told me that some storms were smarter than others. I never believed it... until I sailed on the Forbidden Sea.

The Lost Swordsman Knack.Name: The Lost Swordsman Knack
The Lost Swordsman Knack.Cost: Tack one of your Swordsman Crew
The Lost Swordsman Knack.Trait: 1 Sea Away - Crew Attachment - Swordsman Knack
The Lost Swordsman Knack.Text: React: Tack this card when you are suffering Hits During a Boarding to absorb Hits equal to this Crew's Swordsman Bonus.
The Lost Swordsman Knack.Flavor Text: The panel slid aside, revealing the gleaming blade. "Whatever happens, don't tell the Swordsman's Guild we were here."

The Lure of Gold.Name: The Lure of Gold
The Lure of Gold.Cost: 4 Adv. and Sink two of your untacked Crew.
The Lure of Gold.Text: You draw 1 extra card during the Draw phase.
The Lure of Gold.Flavor Text: "They are good men," the General brooded. "They stood by me when their country abandonned me. And now, I'm going to betray them for a full box of guilders…"

The Marquis d'Arrent.Name: The Marquis d'Arrent
The Marquis d'Arrent.Text: React: Tack when you are paying the Influence cost of a Montaigne Crew with an Influence of 2 or more to produce 3 Influence.
The Marquis d'Arrent.Flavor Text: "Ask and I shall ask and then we will see if you receive."

The Mask of El Vago.Name: The Mask of El Vago
The Mask of El Vago.Text: This Crew has all of their Skills increased by 2 during a Boarding while there is a Villainous Crew on board the other Ship.
The Mask of El Vago.Flavor Text: Live for Castille. Bleed for her people. Die in their name.

The Massacre.Name: The Massacre
The Massacre.Text:
React: After you have inflicted Hits on a Ship in this Sea with an card with the word "Ramming" or "Powering" in the title, tack this Ship to begin a Boarding with that Ship.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Mirror.Name: The Mirror
The Mirror.Flavor Text: "...is as calm and smooth as its namesake. It is there that the Vodaken lurks, waiting for ships who dare the ice blue waters." - The Explorer's Society Guide to Théah

The Mirror - Foil.Name: The Mirror - Foil
The Mirror - Foil.Flavor Text: "...is as calm and smooth as its namesake. It is there that the Vodaken lurks, waiting for ships who dare the ice blue waters." - The Explorer's Society Guide to Théah

The Montaigne Revolution.Name: The Montaigne Revolution
The Montaigne Revolution.Text: Any player may sink this Chantey by tacking any 3 of their Crew as an action. All Crew are considered to have the No Attachments trait (card currently attached to Crew are not discarded).

The Moon Beckoned - Foil.Name: The Moon Beckoned - Foil
The Moon Beckoned - Foil.Text: You may only play this card if all of your Crew are tacked. Move your Ship to an adjacent Sea. Sink this card.
The Moon Beckoned - Foil.Flavor Text: "We drove the ship all night, through the fog, through the ice, through the sun and moon herself. I've never seen a captain so sure of the wind and the stars."

The Navigator.Name: The Navigator
The Navigator.Text: React: After you have moved into a Sea you may tack this Crew and another of your Crew to move your Ship to an adjacent Sea (without cost).

The New World.Name: The New World
The New World.Text: React: Target another player’s Ship when it moves to a Sea adjacent to its previous Sea. Inflict one hit to target Ship. You may only play one copy of this card per Sea moved into.
The New World.Flavor Text: Faust’s map of the west lead to a rich new world full of wonder and plenty. Of course, it was full of danger too...

The Next Chapter.Name: The Next Chapter
The Next Chapter.Text:
React: Play when you push your Captain forward to start a Boarding Attack. Your Captain inflicts 3 extra Hits with this Boarding Attack.
Act: Target another player's Captain with 4 or more Attachments. If your Captain is untacked, play a Boarding Attack from your hand to begin a Duel between your Captain and the target Captain. The Captain playing the final Boarding Attack inflicts no hits, but that player may sink up to 3 Attachments attached to the other Captain.

The Nibelungen's Price.Name: The Nibelungen's Price
The Nibelungen's Price.Text:
React: Play when you are paying the skill cost for an Item Attachment. Discard one of your completed Item or Goods Adventures to reduce the cost by 6 (minimum 0).
React: Play when you are paying the Adventuring cost for an Item or Goods Adventure. If your Ship is the only Ship in this Sea, this card produces an amount of Adventuring equal to your Captain's printed Adventuring.
The Nibelungen's Price.Flavor Text: No one outside of Eisen had ever gained their favor... no one until Bloody Bonnie McGee.
The Nibelungen's Price.Errata: Boarding Attack modified from Dagger to Slash. New ability. Flavor text modified.
The Nibelungen's Price.Changes on MRP: Boarding Attack modified;Text modified;Flavor text modified;Artist modified;

The Noble Emblem of the Montaigne Navy.Name: The Noble Emblem of the Montaigne Navy
The Noble Emblem of the Montaigne Navy.Trait: Montaigne Ship Attachment - Unique - Item - Jolly Roger
The Noble Emblem of the Montaigne Navy.Text: React: Tack after one of your Montaigne Crew has been sunk when absorbing Hits inflicted by another player, to target and untack another of your non-Captain Montaigne Crew. You may only use this ability if you have 3 or more Montaigne Crew on board.

The Noble Flag of the Castillian Armada.Name: The Noble Flag of the Castillian Armada
The Noble Flag of the Castillian Armada.Trait: Castillian Ship Attachment - Unique - Item - Jolly Roger
The Noble Flag of the Castillian Armada.Text: React: Tack after one of your Castillian Crew has been sunk when absorbing Hits inflicted by another player, to target and untack another of your non-Captain Castillian Crew. You may only use this ability if you have 3 or more Castillian Crew on board.

The Ocean's Teeth.Name: The Ocean's Teeth
The Ocean's Teeth.Flavor Text: The northern islands of the Vestenmannavnjar hold more dangers than just mermaids.

The Ogre.Name: The Ogre
The Ogre.Text: This Crew has +1 Swashbuckling during Boardings.

The Ooze.Name: The Ooze
The Ooze.Text: When paying the cost of the card:"Kiss of Death", you may tack this Crew instead of your Captain.
The Ooze.Flavor Text: Wet, dripping slime drops off every time he moves. If it weren't for the sheet, he'd fall completely apart.

The Pact of the Crimson Rogers.Name: The Pact of the Crimson Rogers
The Pact of the Crimson Rogers.Trait: Crimson Roger Captain Attachment - Unique - Letter of Marque
The Pact of the Crimson Rogers.Text:
You must sink one of your Crew to put this card into play.
React: Tack the Pact when performing a Cannon Attack. This Cannon Attack inflicts 2 extra Hits.

The Path to San Cristobal.Name: The Path to San Cristobal
The Path to San Cristobal.Text: Move your Ship to any Sea with a Port card attached (moving through each Sea, one at a time).
The Path to San Cristobal.Flavor Text: "Vaticine City may be Castille's soul, but San Cristobal is her heart - the government, the bureaucracy, the center of her war effort. I intend to burn that heart to ash." - Admiral Valoix

The Porté Escape.Name: The Porté Escape
The Porté Escape.Cost: Tack one of your Sorcerer Crew
The Porté Escape.Text: This Crew gains +2 to their Sorcery trait(s), and may not attach another copy of this card.
The Porté Escape.Flavor Text: The climax of Orduño's rescue - an escape through the largest Porté hole ever created.

The Price of Impatience.Name: The Price of Impatience
The Price of Impatience.Text: React: Tack one of your First Mate Crew when you have suffered and absorbed 5 or more Hits inflicted by another player with a single action. If you are no longer suffering Hits, that player suffers the same amount of Hits. You may play only one copy of this card in reaction to the same suffering of Hits.
The Price of Impatience.Flavor Text: Each trap cost Din another crewman... and each time, he stood up again and continued on his path.

The Prized Emblem of the Explorer's Soci.Name: The Prized Emblem of the Explorer's Society
The Prized Emblem of the Explorer's Soci.Trait: Explorer Ship Attachment - Unique - Item - Jolly Roger
The Prized Emblem of the Explorer's Soci.Text: React: Tack after one of your Explorer Crew has been sunk when absorbing Hits inflicted by another player, to target and untack another of your non-Captain Explorer Crew. You may only use this ability if you have 3 or more Explorer Crew on board.

The Proud Banner of the Vestenmmanavnjar.Name: The Proud Banner of the Vestenmmanavnjar
The Proud Banner of the Vestenmmanavnjar.Trait: Vesten Ship Attachment - Unique - Item - Jolly Roger
The Proud Banner of the Vestenmmanavnjar.Text: React: Tack after one of your Vesten Crew has been sunk when absorbing Hits inflicted by another player, to target and untack another of your non-Captain Vesten Crew. You may only use this ability if you have 3 or more Vesten Crew on board.

The Queen's Reward.Name: The Queen's Reward
The Queen's Reward.Text: While you have more than 2 completed Adventures in play, your Ship's crew maximum is increased by 1.

The Queen's Reward - Foil.Name: The Queen's Reward - Foil
The Queen's Reward - Foil.Text: While you have more than 2 completed Adventures in play, your Ship's crew maximum is increased by 1.

The Rage of the Vesten.Name: The Rage of the Vesten
The Rage of the Vesten.Text: All Crew tacking to absorb Hits absorb 2 extra Hits.
The Rage of the Vesten.Flavor Text: "Ship by Ship, Vendel by Vendel... it's not enough. We need something to destroy them ALL, or else our war will fail." - Red Thorfild

The Ram.Name: The Ram
The Ram.Text:
Your Captain has the trait: Glamour 1 (or +1 to their Glamour if your Captain already has the Glamour trait).
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Raven.Name: The Raven
The Raven.Text: React: Tack the Raven after another player has completed an Adventure in this or an adjacent Sea. That player must pay an additional 3 Adventuring or the completed Adventure is placed in that player's hand without being completed.
The Raven.Flavor Text: "They can't hang him. I haven't robbed him blind yet!"

The Reaper.Name: The Reaper
The Reaper.Text: While you have more than 2 completed Adventures in play and you are involved in a Boarding, your Hand Size is increased by one for the duration of the Boarding

The Reaper - Foil.Name: The Reaper - Foil
The Reaper - Foil.Text: While you have more than 2 completed Adventures in play and you are involved in a Boarding, your Hand Size is increased by one for the duration of the Boarding

The Redeemer.Name: The Redeemer
The Redeemer.Text:
React: Once per turn, when tacking a Crew to produce skill points, that Crew produces 2 extra points of that skill, if the Crew has an Adventure attached that increases the skill being produced.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Revenge of the Damned.Name: The Revenge of the Damned
The Revenge of the Damned.Text: Any player may sink this Chantey by tacking their Ship and Captain as an Action. The Ship(s) with the most Crew on board has its Move Cost increased by 2.
The Revenge of the Damned.Flavor Text: The Black Freighter sailed for the Mirror, leaving a trail of haunted destruction in its wake. Necros knew that Gosse would follow.

The Revensj.Name: The Revensj
The Revensj.Text:
When you start a Boarding that is not canceled, draw 2 cards.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Revensj - Foil.Name: The Revensj - Foil
The Revensj - Foil.Text:
When you start a Boarding that is not canceled, draw 2 cards.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Right Place.Name: The Right Place
The Right Place.Text: Act: Tack this Crew and sink this card. Move your Ship to any Sea.
The Right Place.Flavor Text: "But there's nothing there, Alesio! Just empty water! " "I know - and I don't know why we have to there - but if we don't, the Brotherhood will die..."

The Rise of Cabora.Name: The Rise of Cabora
The Rise of Cabora.Text: This Crew absorbs 3 extra Hits when tacking to absorb Hits.
The Rise of Cabora.Flavor Text: Allende threw the switch. The Syrneth vessel gave a groan and pulled away from Caligari's Island, releasing thousand of years of pent-up pressure. Far away, in the heart of the Mirror, something began to rise…

The River.Name: The River
The River.Text: React: Tack The River when you are paying an Influence cost to produce 1 Influence.
The River.Flavor Text: It cuts through the continent like a broad blade. Control it, and you control Théah.

The Rogers' Folly.Name: The Rogers' Folly
The Rogers' Folly.Text:
Act: Target a Ship in this Sea with a tacked Crimson Roger Captain on board. Inflict 4 hits on that Ship.
Act: Tack one of your Crew to draw 1 card from your Deck.
The Rogers' Folly.Flavor Text: "You're afraid of her, aren't you? You're afraid of what she can do." Javier held up the Setine Key for his Captain to see. "What if I told you that I have a way to even the odds? What if I told you, I have a way to make you immortal..."

The Sacrifice.Name: The Sacrifice
The Sacrifice.Text:
Act: Target one of your Crew in this Sea. Discard any number of cards attached to the target Crew.
Act: Discard any one of your Attachments to target a player with a Ship in this Sea. The target player must discard any one of their Attachments.
The Sacrifice.Flavor Text: "The gods need blood, Guttormson. Take mine." - Red Thorfild's last words

The Sailor's Curse.Name: The Sailor's Curse
The Sailor's Curse.Text: Target a Crew with Influence less than 2. That Crew tacks.
