The Sailor's Curse.Flavor Text: A purse of gold and a pretty face. Don't belong in the same place. Wake with no clothes, no gold, no purse. A love for the Jennies is the sailor's curse. - Traditional Shanty

The Santa Cecilia.Name: The Santa Cecilia
The Santa Cecilia.Text:
React: Once per turn, after you have entered a Sea, you may immediately perform a cannon attack.
React: Tack before performing an Action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Scarlet Roger.Name: The Scarlet Roger
The Scarlet Roger.Text:
You may cancel a Boarding targeting your Ship by paying 4 Cannon (this cost may not be reduced).
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Scarlet Roger - Foil.Name: The Scarlet Roger - Foil
The Scarlet Roger - Foil.Text:
You may cancel a Boarding targeting your Ship by paying 4 Cannon (this cost may not be reduced).
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Sea Dog's Folly.Name: The Sea Dog's Folly
The Sea Dog's Folly.Text:
Act: Target a Ship in this Sea with a tacked Sea Dogs Captain on board. Inflict 4 hits on that Ship.
Act: Tack one of your Crew to draw 1 card from your Deck.
The Sea Dog's Folly.Flavor Text: Lyin' John's betrayal struck at the heart of the Crew's moral. Who could they trust if one of their own acted against them ?

The Sea Lion.Name: The Sea Lion
The Sea Lion.Text:
Act: Once per turn, tack one of your Port Attachments to untack your Captain.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Seal of the Thalusai.Name: The Seal of the Thalusai
The Seal of the Thalusai.Text: React: Tack the Seal of the Thalusai when another play uses a Sorcer Knack. After the effects of that Knack have resolved, sink that Knack.
The Seal of the Thalusai.Flavor Text: It snuffs out magic like a torch.

The Second Switch.Name: The Second Switch
The Second Switch.Flavor Text: "The compass has led us here," Mc Cormick whispered as he pressed the Syrneth Device. "But this is only the first step…"

The Setine Key.Name: The Setine Key
The Setine Key.Text:
The cost of this card is zero if you have a Crimson Roger Captain.
React: When one of your Crew aligned to your Captain's Faction tacks for a skill, tack to increase that Crew's skill production by 1.
The Setine Key.Flavor Text: Bejarano thought he had found the key to immortality.

The Shattered Spear.Name: The Shattered Spear
The Shattered Spear.Trait: Prize - 1 Sea Away - Unique - Item - Crew Attachment
The Shattered Spear.Text: React: Tack the Shattered Spear when paying an Influence cost to produce 3 Influence.
The Shattered Spear.Flavor Text: Though destroyed, its pieces are not without power...

The Shield Man.Name: The Shield Man
The Shield Man.Text: React: Tack when one of your Crew is absorbing Hits during a Boarding Attack. If you have more than 2 completed Adventures in play, the Crew absorbs 3 extra Hits.

The Shield Man - Foil.Name: The Shield Man - Foil
The Shield Man - Foil.Text: React: Tack when one of your Crew is absorbing Hits during a Boarding Attack. If you have more than 2 completed Adventures in play, the Crew absorbs 3 extra Hits.

The Sinking of the Hanged Man.Name: The Sinking of the Hanged Man
The Sinking of the Hanged Man.Text: Target a Ship in this Sea. Attach this card to that Ship as a Damage Attachment. While attached, the Ship may not hire Crew or move to another Sea. Any player in the same Sea may sink this card by tacking 5 Swashbuckling as an Action. This card may not be sunk or discarded with other card effects.
The Sinking of the Hanged Man.Flavor Text: Berek's warning had saved them from the flames. Now they needed another ship.

The Sinking of the Hurricane.Name: The Sinking of the Hurricane
The Sinking of the Hurricane.Text: Any player may sink this card by paying 3 Adventuring as an Action. All Crew inflict an additional amount of Hits equal to their Cannon skill during a Duel.
The Sinking of the Hurricane.Flavor Text: The Rogers caught up to their nemesis while Bonnie and Reis battled on the nearby island. They would have sunk the crew for good had an old friend not made a last minute rescue.

The Siren's Jaw.Name: The Siren's Jaw
The Siren's Jaw.Cost: 6 Adv.; 4 if you have a Corsairs captain
The Siren's Jaw.Trait: 2 Seas Away - Unique - Artifact - Captain Attachment
The Siren's Jaw.Text: React: Tack and sink this card when your Captain is inflicting Hits with a Boarding Attack. Your Captain inflicts an additional number of Hits equal to the number of cards currently in your hand.
The Siren's Jaw.Flavor Text: I hear he bought it from Kheired-Din himself.

The Sixth Switch.Name: The Sixth Switch
The Sixth Switch.Cost: 8 Adv.; 5 if your Ship's printed crew maximum is less than 9
The Sixth Switch.Trait: Unique - 2 Seas Away - Artifact - Ship Attachment
The Sixth Switch.Text: React: Tack this card after you tack a Crew to produce Adventuring to complete an Adventure (not this one). Untack that Crew.
The Sixth Switch.Flavor Text: "It's a Syrneth vessel," Fasut breathed. "It's power holds the entire island up..."

The Sole Presence.Name: The Sole Presence
The Sole Presence.Text: React: Play after another player's Ship has moved from this Sea and left your Ship as the only Ship in this Sea. If no other players have Control cards in this Sea, tack your Captain or one of your First Mate Crew to attach this card to this Sea as a Control card. While this card is attached to this Sea, any player in this Sea may sink this Control card as an action by tacking their Captain or one of their First Mate Crew.
The Sole Presence.Flavor Text: "Rulers of the waves we be! Masters of all we... was that a cannonball?"

The Sorcerer's Duty.Name: The Sorcerer's Duty
The Sorcerer's Duty.Text:
You must tack one of your Sorcerers to attach this card. This Sorcerer gains +1 to their Sorcery trait(s).
Act: Tack this Crew and name a skill to target another of your Crew. Target Crew gains a bonus to the skill equal to the number of Sorcery Knacks attached to this Crew until the end of the turn.

The Spear of the West Wind.Name: The Spear of the West Wind
The Spear of the West Wind.Text: React: Tack one of your Crew with Lærdom to target another Ship when it enters this Sea. Inflict 4 Hits on the target Ship.
The Spear of the West Wind.Flavor Text: The Spear is an island inscribed with a powerful weather rune. Even the Vesten had forgotten about it… but not Necros.

The Spear of Theus.Name: The Spear of Theus
The Spear of Theus.Text: Act: Tack Spear of Theus and pay sailing equal to your Ship's move cost to target a ship in this Sea. If you have more than 2 completed Adventures in play, you inflict 4 Hits on that ship

The Spear of Theus - Foil.Name: The Spear of Theus - Foil
The Spear of Theus - Foil.Text: Act: Tack Spear of Theus and pay sailing equal to your Ship's move cost to target a ship in this Sea. If you have more than 2 completed Adventures in play, you inflict 4 Hits on that ship

The Stake.Name: The Stake
The Stake.Text: Target a Sea. The Adventuring cost to complete Adventures in the target Sea is increased by 2 until the end of the turn.
The Stake.Flavor Text: "Oh no, the moon's rising…" - Mortimer Snuff

The Stalwart Raider.Name: The Stalwart Raider
The Stalwart Raider.Text:
Act: Tack to sink a Sea Attachment attached to this Sea.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Syrneth Rings.Name: The Syrneth Rings
The Syrneth Rings.Cost: 4 Adv.; 3 if you have an Invisible College Captain
The Syrneth Rings.Trait: 1 Sea Away - Unique - Artifact - Crew Attachment
The Syrneth Rings.Text: React: Tack this Crew when a Chantey is being sunk from play to place that Chantey in its owner's discard pile instead.

The Syrneth Secret.Name: The Syrneth Secret
The Syrneth Secret.Text: You must be in the Trade Sea to play this card. Any player in this Sea may discard this card by tacking a Heroic or Villainous Crew and paying 5 Cannon as an action. If your Ship is in this Sea during the Draw Cards phase, you may draw 2 additional cards
The Syrneth Secret.Flavor Text: "Cabora was the key to unlocking the west. The way lies open. We need only sail it."

The Third Switch.Name: The Third Switch
The Third Switch.Text: When you complete this Adventure, target and discard all uncompleted Adventures and all Sea Attachments in this Sea.
The Third Switch.Flavor Text: The two crews faced each other, Explorer and Corsair, over a side they both thought was secret. Each side waited for the other to flinch...

The Three Fate Witches.Name: The Three Fate Witches
The Three Fate Witches.Text: Tack all cards in play with the Fate trait.
The Three Fate Witches.Flavor Text: "They came from Vodacce to find their errant sisters, carrying silver shears tucked into their corsets. Grown men screamed like little girls whenever they took them out." - Guy McCormick

The Trail of the Dead.Name: The Trail of the Dead
The Trail of the Dead.Text: All Crew tacking or sinking to absorb Hits, absorb 1 fewer Hit (minimum 1)
The Trail of the Dead.Flavor Text: The family drew together, praying for a quick death as the Freighter's Crew drew closer...

The Traitor's Scream.Name: The Traitor's Scream
The Traitor's Scream.Trait: Black Freighter Ship Attachment - Unique - Figurehead
The Traitor's Scream.Text: React: Tack when an opposing Crew is sunk during a Boarding involving your Ship. If you have 2 or more completed Adventures in play, you may put a Skeletal Crew into play from your hand, without cost
The Traitor's Scream.Flavor Text: The former captain, now a living figurehead. You can hear his folly in every tortured howl.

The Traitor's Scream - Foil.Name: The Traitor's Scream - Foil
The Traitor's Scream - Foil.Trait: Black Freighter Ship Attachment - Unique - Figurehead
The Traitor's Scream - Foil.Text: React: Tack when an opposing Crew is sunk during a Boarding involving your Ship. If you have 2 or more completed Adventures in play, you may put a Skeletal Crew into play from your hand, without cost
The Traitor's Scream - Foil.Flavor Text: The former captain, now a living figurehead. You can hear his folly in every tortured howl.

The Trap is Sprung.Name: The Trap is Sprung
The Trap is Sprung.Text: React: Tack one of your Kreuzritter Crew when you are paying an Influence cost (for anything other than hiring a Crew), to reduce that Influence cost by the Kreuzritter's Influence Cost (minimum 0). Until the end of the turn all of your opponent's Influence costs are reduced by 1 (minimum 0).
The Trap is Sprung.Flavor Text: "Welcom aboard, Empereur. Some old friends wish to have a word with you..." - The Kire

The Trial of Orduño.Name: The Trial of Orduño
The Trial of Orduño.Text: Any player may sink this Chantey by discarding any two of their untacked Crew as an Action. All Captains have the following ability: Act: Tack your Captain and your Ship to move to your Starting Sea.
The Trial of Orduño.Flavor Text: "I find you guilty of heresy and conspiracy against the Church. You shall burn for your sins."

The Undefeated Heart.Name: The Undefeated Heart
The Undefeated Heart.Text:
Monster and Weather cards inflicting hits on this Ship inflicts 4 fewer Hits (min 0).
React: Tack before performing an Action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Undiscovered Port.Name: The Undiscovered Port
The Undiscovered Port.Text:
Act: Tack to untack one of your Ally cards in this Sea.
Act:  If your Ship is in this Sea, tack to untack your Ship.

The Unrelenting Depths.Name: The Unrelenting Depths
The Unrelenting Depths.Text: Any player may pay the cancel cost of this card. Untack one of your Sea Attachments.
The Unrelenting Depths.Flavor Text: They call it Cabora, the Island of the Sunken Eye. It has lain beneath the waves for untold millennia, but now, something has begun to stir...

The Unwritten Rules.Name: The Unwritten Rules
The Unwritten Rules.Trait: Gosse Captain Attachment - Letter of Marque - Unique
The Unwritten Rules.Text:
You may not put this card into play if any other player has more Heroic Crew in play than you.
Act: Sink the Unwritten Rules, and get any card from your deck, show it to your opponents, and put it in your hand. Shuffle your deck.
The Unwritten Rules.Flavor Text: Every man knows them, and none need reminding.

The Value of the Hunt.Name: The Value of the Hunt
The Value of the Hunt.Text: Any player may sink this Chantey by sinking two of their Adventures (completed or uncompleted) from play or from their hand (or both) as an action. When non-Captain Crew tack to produce skill points, they produce an additional amount of those skill points equal to the number of completed Adventures they have attached.

The Vestenmannavnjar's Folly.Name: The Vestenmannavnjar's Folly
The Vestenmannavnjar's Folly.Text:
Act: Target a Ship in this Sea with a tacked Vesten Captain on board. Inflict 4 hits on that Ship.
Act: Tack one of your Crew to draw 1 card from your Deck.
The Vestenmannavnjar's Folly.Flavor Text: "I find this intensely unpleasant." Jorund smiled as he slid the knife deeper. "Please tell me where your Captain is headed, so we can both move on to less troublesom activities."

The Vision Spreads.Name: The Vision Spreads
The Vision Spreads.Text: All Crew have their Influence cost increased by 2.
The Vision Spreads.Flavor Text: Cardinal Verdugo fell to his knees as the vision overwhelmed him. "The  Island!" he screamed. "The Fourth Prophet approaches!"

The Vow.Name: The Vow
The Vow.Trait: Rose and Cross Crew Attachment - Oath
The Vow.Text: When you attach this card to a Crew, name a skill. This Crew gains +3 to the named skill while this card is attached. This card is discarded at the end of the turn.
The Vow.Flavor Text: "I will avenge your loss. I swear on my immortal soul."

The Wayward Route.Name: The Wayward Route
The Wayward Route.Text:
React: Untack this Ship after completing a Boarding where you were the Defender.
React: Tack before performing an Action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Wayward Soldier.Name: The Wayward Soldier
The Wayward Soldier.Text:
Act: Tack to move your Ship up to two Seas away (moving through each Sea one at a time).
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Wayward Swan.Name: The Wayward Swan
The Wayward Swan.Text:
React: Tack one of your Ally cards in this Sea instead of paying your move cost to begin a Boarding.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

The Wellspring.Name: The Wellspring
The Wellspring.Text: Act: Tack your Captain or one of your First Mate Crew to play this card. Until the end of the turn, all of your Crew aligned to your Captain's faction absorb 2 extra Hits when tacking to absorb Hits.
The Wellspring.Flavor Text: Yngvild felt her ancestors shirek with rage. Then she saw Red standing among them - guiding them into her waiting body.

The Witch.Name: The Witch
The Witch.Text:
React: Play instead of performing a Boarding Attack. Tack a Crew to target a Crew Attachment on a tacked Crew on the opposing player's Ship. Discard the target Crew Attachment (you may not discard a Captain Attachment, but you may discard a Crew Attachment on a Captain).
React: Play after you have canceled a boarding Attempt by paying your Ship's Move Cost to move your Ship to an adajcent Sea.
The Witch.Flavor Text: Lucrezia still searches for her lost love.

The Witches Return.Name: The Witches Return
The Witches Return.Text: Target and sink a Chantey in play to draw 1 card from your deck.
The Witches Return.Flavor Text: With the Inquisitor looking on, the witches drew their shears and formed a circle around the two men.. "If you wish to find Allende so badly, my pets, we can arrange for you to join him..."

The Witches' Shears.Name: The Witches' Shears
The Witches' Shears.Text: Act: Tack and discard this Crew to sink a non-Captain Crew in play with a lower Influence.
The Witches' Shears.Flavor Text: The blades flashed in the Witches's hands, cutting Allende's fate thread like a puppet's strings. "You have no future, Pirate King… save with us…"

The Word of the Vagabond.Name: The Word of the Vagabond
The Word of the Vagabond.Text:
The cost of this card is reduced by 2 (minimum 0) if you have a Brotherhood Captain.
React: Tack Word of the Vagabond after you put an Adventure into play to draw a card from your deck.
The Word of the Vagabond.Flavor Text: "Captain Allende is indeed the heir to the Castillian throne. When the Caligaris have broken him, they will return him home, a puppet king to do as they command."

The Wrath of Reis.Name: The Wrath of Reis
The Wrath of Reis.Text: React: Play when the other player in a Boarding tacks a Crew to absorb Hits. The number of Hits absorbed is reduced to zero. The cost to play this card is reduced to zero if you have a Crimson Roger Captain.
The Wrath of Reis.Flavor Text: "That will do nicely, Riant. We don't want him dying before he talks" - Reis

Théah Eats the Weak.Name: Théah Eats the Weak
Théah Eats the Weak.Text: Target a Ship. Inflict 3 Hits on that Ship.
Théah Eats the Weak.Flavor Text: "If the sea wants you, it'll take you. Don't mean you have to like it, though." - Jacob Faust

Their Captain's Will.Name: Their Captain's Will
Their Captain's Will.Flavor Text: They fear their captain more than any wind or storm. One look from Kheired-Din could get them up a mountain using only the sail.

Things to Come.Name: Things to Come
Things to Come.Text: All Captains have the following ability and may use it once per turn: Act: Target a deck and look at the top card of that deck.
Things to Come.Flavor Text: Faust watched the spinning globe with awestruck wonder. "The gate is lowered," he whispered. "We can sail west."

Thom Brunner.Name: Thom Brunner
Thom Brunner.Flavor Text: "No Sir, Captain Allende, Sir. I don't mind the small quarters at all. More room here than in my cell back on the island, that's for certain."

Thomas Gosse.Name: Thomas Gosse
Thomas Gosse.Text: React: Tack Thomas when another Ship enters your Sea to untack one of your Crew, except the Captain.
Thomas Gosse.Flavor Text: "He's been up there for twelve straight hours. Run him up a glass of water or something, will you please?" - Philip Gosse

Thomas Gosse - Exp..Name: Thomas Gosse - Exp.
Thomas Gosse - Exp..Text: The Adventuring cost of your action cards that reduce the number of Hits you suffer is reduced by 3 (minimum 0).
Thomas Gosse - Exp..Flavor Text: "Uncle Philip... why couldn't you save me, Uncle Philip..."

Thomas Metzger.Name: Thomas Metzger
Thomas Metzger.Text: Thomas' Boarding Attacks that finish with a Punch inflict 2 extra Hits.
Thomas Metzger.Flavor Text: I used to be Thomas Zahnarzt, but I had it changed.

Thordis Bjerregaard.Name: Thordis Bjerregaard
Thordis Bjerregaard.Text: React: Untack Thordis after your Ship enters a Boarding that is not canceled. Thordis may perform this reaction once per turn.

Through the 7th Sea.Name: Through the 7th Sea
Through the 7th Sea.Text: Any player may sink this Chantey by paying 6 Adventuring as an action. Players with a Ship in the Trade Sea may, as an action, pay their Ship's Move Cost to move their Ship to The Mirror, and vice-versa.
Through the 7th Sea.Flavor Text: The Strange Skies shot towards the watersprout, leaving the Discovery behind. "What about the final switch?" McCormick asked. The Din smiled. "Shala will see to it."

Through the Magic Mirror.Name: Through the Magic Mirror
Through the Magic Mirror.Text: +2 Swashbuckling. This crew inflicts 2 extra Hits during Boarding Attacks.
Through the Magic Mirror.Flavor Text: Bonnie stepped through the Grey Queen's mirror, into the realm beyond. She stepped back minutes later, but her face aged three years.

Through the Portal.Name: Through the Portal
Through the Portal.Text: Act: Tack this Crew, and target a Crew, except a Captain. Tack the target Crew.
Through the Portal.Flavor Text: We heard a thin scream over the roar of the cannons. Then Marc shouted, and I turned to see a Montaigne light a fuse on a barrel of gunpowder...

Throwing Knives.Name: Throwing Knives
Throwing Knives.Text: React: Tack and discard Throwing Knives instead of performing a Boarding Attack to inflict 1 Hit on the opposing Ship.
Throwing Knives.Flavor Text: "Let's play a game. Its called Cripple the Loudmouth."

Tiger Claws.Name: Tiger Claws
Tiger Claws.Text: React: Tack this card when this Crew inflicts Hits during a Boarding Attack. Action cards which react to suffering Hits may not be played in reaction to these Hits.
Tiger Claws.Flavor Text: "Where on Théah did he learn that?"
Tiger Claws.Artist: Luis del Vazquez de Barcino del Castillo

Tight-Knit Crew.Name: Tight-Knit Crew
Tight-Knit Crew.Text: While your Ship's crew maximum is less than 9, your hand size is increased by 1.
Tight-Knit Crew.Flavor Text: "We're gonna find that murderin' bilge rat, an' we're gonna see if his guts are as red as his sails. So says I. So says we all." - Bloody Bonnie McGee

Timothy le Beau.Name: Timothy le Beau
Timothy le Beau.Text: Act: Tack Timothy and target a Ship. Timothy inflicts 1 Hit on that Ship.
Timothy le Beau.Flavor Text: "Are you sure you were able to drop that penny into the Captain's pocket, Pepin?" The boy nodded. Timothy grinned and rubbed his bloody hands together.

Timothy le Beau - Exp..Name: Timothy le Beau - Exp.
Timothy le Beau - Exp..Trait: Experienced - Unique - First Mate - Loyal - Porté 2
Timothy le Beau - Exp..Text: Act: Tack Timothy and target a Ship. Timothy inflicts 2 Hits on that Ship.
Timothy le Beau - Exp..Flavor Text: "I'm the best you'll ever see. The Portal and I, we have an understanding."

To Fight Another Day.Name: To Fight Another Day
To Fight Another Day.Text: React: Play when another player is discarding or sinking one of your Sea Attachments. Your Sea Attachment remains in play.
To Fight Another Day.Flavor Text: Bonnie cut the last rope and the Black Dawn sped away. "I swear," she whispered back at Reis. "I swear that someday you'll pay."

To the Death!.Name: To the Death!
To the Death!.Text: Target one of your Black Freighter Crew. Until the end of the turn, that Crew gains +2 Swashbuckling.
To the Death!.Flavor Text: "It hurts? That's good. Pain is the only link you'll have to the living." - Victor of Luthon

To the Last Man.Name: To the Last Man
To the Last Man.Text: Any player may sink this Chantey by discarding a Crew from play as an action. All Captains are considered to have the following abilities: React: Tack or discard one of your Crew when you are producing Sailing to attempt a Boarding. The cost of that Boarding attempt is reduced by the Crew's Adventuring. React: Discard one of your Crew from play instead of performing a Boarding Attack to inflict Hits on the other Ship equal to the Crew's Swashbuckling.

Tom \"Grave\" Stone.Name: Tom "Grave" Stone
Tom \"Grave\" Stone.Text: React: Tack this Crew when one of your non-Skeletal Black Freighter crew is being sunk to place that Crew on top of your deck.
Tom \"Grave\" Stone.Flavor Text: His experiments on prolonging life succeeded after all…

Tom Toblin.Name: Tom Toblin
Tom Toblin.Text: While Tom is in play, your Item Attachments have their Influence costs reduced by 1 (minimum 0).
Tom Toblin.Flavor Text: "Tom" is hiding behind her dead brother's name until she's ready to bring the bastard who killed him to justice.

Too Close for Comfort.Name: Too Close for Comfort
Too Close for Comfort.Text: React: Play when you tack a Crew to absorb Hits. That Crew absorbs 2 extra Hits.
Too Close for Comfort.Flavor Text: If I'd needed a shave, I would've asked for it.

Too Strong to Die.Name: Too Strong to Die
Too Strong to Die.Text: React: Play when an opponent is suffering more than 5 Hits. The Hits are reduced to zero. That player must sink 3 random cards from their Hand.
Too Strong to Die.Flavor Text: Fitzpatrick grimaced in pain as he pulled the quarrel from his side. "I ain't dead yet…"

Tools of the Trade.Name: Tools of the Trade
Tools of the Trade.Text: React: Play when you are paying a skill cost. Discard 3 cards from your hand to produce 2 points of Cannon, Sailing, Adventuring, Influence, or Swashbuckling.
Tools of the Trade.Flavor Text: "We're Explorers after all. We should have known this would involve digging." - Guy Mc Cormick

Top Dog.Name: Top Dog
Top Dog.Text: Target a Ship with more than one First Mate. That player must sink all but one of their First Mates. Tack the remaining First Mate.
Top Dog.Flavor Text: Cosette felt ill at eas whenever Mumblety Peg was near her. There was something odd going on...

Topaz Pendant.Name: Topaz Pendant
Topaz Pendant.Text: React: Discard when you are paying a skill cost to produce 2 points of that skill.
Topaz Pendant.Flavor Text: The flaw formed naturally, believe it or not - one of the reasons the crew considers it good luck.

Torvo Espada.Name: Torvo Espada
Torvo Espada.Text: If Torvo plays a Club, Dagger, Punch, Slash, and Thrust during the same Boarding Attack, his opponent may not play any more Boarding Attack cards during this Boarding Attack.
Torvo Espada.Flavor Text: "Don Aldana took credit for my father's swordsman school. I will not rest until he is dead."

Torvo Espada - Exp..Name: Torvo Espada - Exp.
Torvo Espada - Exp..Text: Torvo may not have more than 1 copy of an Swordsman Knack attached. The Influence cost to attach Swordsman Knacks to Torvo is 2 less (minimum 0).
Torvo Espada - Exp..Flavor Text: "Philip's quest must come before mine. We can only correct one injustice at a time."

Tracey Anvilin.Name: Tracey Anvilin
Tracey Anvilin.Text: There is no limits to the number of Swordsman Knacks Tracey may have attached (overriding the text on the Swordsman Knacks).
Tracey Anvilin.Flavor Text: "Don’'t point that thing at me. Believe me, I know more about swordsmanship than you ever will."
Tracey Anvilin.Errata: May still attach swordsman knacks if Pitching Decks is played.

Trade Sea.Name: Trade Sea
Trade Sea.Flavor Text: "...lies to the north and is home to Avalon and the Vendel. It is also home to the isle of the Sidhe and the horrible, man-eating mermaids." - The Explorer's Society Guide to Théah

Trade Sea - Foil.Name: Trade Sea - Foil
Trade Sea - Foil.Flavor Text: "...lies to the north and is home to Avalon and the Vendel. It is also home to the isle of the Sidhe and the horrible, man-eating mermaids." - The Explorer's Society Guide to Théah

Treasure Hold.Name: Treasure Hold
Treasure Hold.Text:
The Treasure Hold counts as one Crew against your crew maximum. You may sink the Treasure Hold to absorb 1 Hit.
React: Tack the Treasure Hold when you are paying an Influence cost to produce 2 Influence.

Trechaut.Name: Trechaut
Trechaut.Text: Any player in this Sea may sink this card by producing 4 Swashbuckling as an action. Holy Crew in this Seahave +1 to all of their skills.
Trechaut.Flavor Text: An utterly unremarkable village holding a wholly remarkable secret.
Trechaut.Artist: Travis Moore and Dærick W. Gröss

Trickster's Grin.Name: Trickster's Grin
Trickster's Grin.Text: Act: Tack this Crew to draw a card.
Trickster's Grin.Flavor Text: "One rescued Castillian admiral coming right up." - Timothy le Beau

Trinkets and Baubles.Name: Trinkets and Baubles
Trinkets and Baubles.Trait: 1 Sea Away - Illegal - Goods - Crew Attachment
Trinkets and Baubles.Flavor Text: "You like it? Keep it. There's a chest full of them back at home." - Philip Gosse

True Faith.Name: True Faith
True Faith.Text: +1 Swasbuckling and this Crew gains the Holy trait.
True Faith.Flavor Text: Margaretta landed in a pile of sailors. "You've had your fun, señores, but San Cristobal will not fall today."

Tugging the Strands.Name: Tugging the Strands
Tugging the Strands.Text:
May only be attached to a Crew with Fate 2 or more.
Act: The Actions phase ends. Play proceeds to the Draw phase. Sink this card.
Tugging the Strands.Flavor Text: Alesio closed her eyes as the General's cannons fired. Destiny would be changed now, or the Brotherhood would die beneath the onslaught.

Tungsinn (\"Gloom\").Name: Tungsinn ("Gloom")
Tungsinn (\"Gloom\").Text: React: Tack instead of performing a Boarding Attack. Target and tack a Crew on the other Ship with an Influence cost less than double this Crew's Lærdom.
Tungsinn (\"Gloom\").Flavor Text: "Tell me how to reach Cabora", Yngvild snarled at the Explorer, "before I rot your crew along with your ship."

Turning Enemies Into Friends.Name: Turning Enemies Into Friends
Turning Enemies Into Friends.Text: You may only play this card if you have a Heroic Captain. Target another player. The next time that player pays an Influence cost, this card produces 2 Influence for that player, then attaches to your Captain. This Attachment may be discarded when you are paying an Influence cost to produce 4 Influence.
Turning Enemies Into Friends.Flavor Text: "If the General's treating you so badly, why don't you sign on with a real sailor?" - Lyin' John Fox

Two Dagger Dirk.Name: Two Dagger Dirk
Two Dagger Dirk.Text: React: Discard a card from your hand after Dirk has played a Boarding Attack. Change that Boarding Attack to a Slash.
Two Dagger Dirk.Flavor Text: "I used to do this trick in the circus. Don't move, you could really get hurt."

Two Hands Are Better Than One.Name: Two Hands Are Better Than One
Two Hands Are Better Than One.Text: React: Tack when you send this Crew out to fight against an opponent's non-Swordsman Crew that has been pushed forward to start a Boarding Attack. This Crew gains +1 Swashbuckling for each Attachment attached to the opposing Crew until the end of the Boarding.

Two Pistol Penny.Name: Two Pistol Penny
Two Pistol Penny.Text: When this Crew inflicts Hits with a Boarding Attack, she inflicts an additional amount of Hits equal to your Captain's Swashbuckling.

Two-Toe Terrance.Name: Two-Toe Terrance
Two-Toe Terrance.Flavor Text: "Nah, I'm all right. Just lost me footin', that's all. Give me a moment ta catch me breath, and I'll be right back up in the riggin' where I belongs."

Tyler Jones.Name: Tyler Jones
Tyler Jones.Text:
While you have 4 or more other Sea Dogs Crew on board you may use the following abilities: React: After you have resolved a Boarding as the attacker and at least one opposing Crew was sunk, you may tack one of your Crew to untack one of your Crew with a Cannon skill of 6 or more.
React: After you have resolved a Cannon Attack against another player and at least one opposing Crew was sunk, you may tack one of your Crew to untack one of your Crew with a Sailing skill of 5 or more.

Tyree the Worthless.Name: Tyree the Worthless
Tyree the Worthless.Text:
Tyree may not be put into play if you already have a First Mate in play.
React: Tack and discard Tyree when you put a First Mate into play from your hand to reduce the Crew's cost by 8 (minimum 0).
Tyree the Worthless.Flavor Text: "We could always keel-haul him if we get bored…"

Ulf Karlssen.Name: Ulf Karlssen
Ulf Karlssen.Text: Ulf has -1 Sailing for every Lærdom card you attach to him. You may not attach a Lærdom card to Ulf if his Sailing is less than 1.
Ulf Karlssen.Flavor Text: "My ancestors told me to follow McCormick. They say he leads to wonders that the world has never seen..."

Ulfgar Jor Brønsen.Name: Ulfgar Jor Brønsen
Ulfgar Jor Brønsen.Flavor Text: "If you have a question, I'll ask my ancestors. It is not I who leads you to your prize, it is they."

Ulfied Jansson.Name: Ulfied Jansson
Ulfied Jansson.Text: Act: Tack Ulfied to inflict 2 Hits on a Ship in this Sea. If you are in the Trade Sea, Reacts may not be played in reaction to suffering these Hits.
Ulfied Jansson.Flavor Text: "We're not all obsessed with vengeance. I live my life as I choose, and neither Vendel nor Vestenmannavnjar can tell me otherwise."

Ulrich the Unholy.Name: Ulrich the Unholy
Ulrich the Unholy.Text: Act: Tack this Crew to target and tack a Holy Crew in this Sea.
Ulrich the Unholy.Flavor Text: "Shall I show you Legion's true face? Could you resist it more than I did?"

Uncharted Course.Name: Uncharted Course
Uncharted Course.Text:
Your Ship Attachments do not count toward your crew maximum.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

Uncharted Course - Foil.Name: Uncharted Course - Foil
Uncharted Course - Foil.Text:
Your Ship Attachments do not count toward your crew maximum.
React: Tack before performing an action, to move to an adjacent Sea.

Undead Adventurers.Name: Undead Adventurers
Undead Adventurers.Text: React: When you are suffering Hits you may discard a completed Adventure attached to this Crew to suffer 3 fewer Hits.
Undead Adventurers.Flavor Text: Necros wanted Cabora... but he wouldn't dare set foot on it until a scouting party had explored it first.

Undead Ambush.Name: Undead Ambush
Undead Ambush.Text: React: Play when you are inflicting exactly 2 Hits to inflict 2 extra Hits.
Undead Ambush.Flavor Text: The skeletons exploded from the darkness around Gosse and Mabela. "It's a trap!"

Undead Boarders.Name: Undead Boarders
Undead Boarders.Text: During a Boarding, this Crew may tack to absorb Hits.
Undead Boarders.Flavor Text: The crew hacked madly at the advancing horrors. For every ghost that fell, two more rose to take its place.

Underwater Cave.Name: Underwater Cave
Underwater Cave.Text: React: Play when one of your Crew is targeted by a card which begins a Duel. Cancel that action.
Underwater Cave.Flavor Text: "Oh no, she's coming back..." - Mortimer Snuff

Unexpected Hero.Name: Unexpected Hero
Unexpected Hero.Text: This card may only be attached to a Cew with the No Attachments trait. This Crew no longer has the No Attachments trait.
Unexpected Hero.Flavor Text: "I- I killed him..." - Rosamonde du Montaigne

Unexpected Reunion.Name: Unexpected Reunion
Unexpected Reunion.Text:
React: Play when a player hires a Crew from a different faction than their Captain's Faction. If that Crew does not share a Secret Society or Nationality with that player's Captain, that player's Ship suffers Hits equal to twice the hired Crew's Swashbuckling. You may only play one copy of this card per hiring of a Crew.
React: Play when you are paying the cost of a Henchman Attachment card to reduce the Henchman's cost by 3. When playing this effect, the cost of this card is reduced to 0.

Unexpected Turn of Events.Name: Unexpected Turn of Events
Unexpected Turn of Events.Text: React: Play when a player in another Sea performs an action that causes you to suffer Hits. That player suffers the Hits instead of you.
Unexpected Turn of Events.Flavor Text: "Didn't expect to see us again, didya Smith? This is what your mother looks like, eh Diddles?" "Ooo. Yus gonna pay for that, Smith. Yus gonna pay."

Unreliable.Name: Unreliable
Unreliable.Text:
Act: Target a Cheap card in play. Discard that card.
React: Play when a Cheap card is used. Cancel the effects of that card and discard it.
Unreliable.Flavor Text: "Stay away... I still got a hilt!"

Up and Ready.Name: Up and Ready
Up and Ready.Text: Act: Target a non-Skeletal Crew aligned to your Captain's faction in your sunk pile. You may immediately pay that Crew's Influence cost to hire the target Crew. This card attaches to the target Crew, and gives the Crew the Skeletal trait (This Crew may not tack to absorb Hits. Place this Crew in your discard pile when it is sunk). If this card is removed from the Crew while the Crew is still in play, the Crew loses the Skeletal trait, and then is immediately sunk.
Up and Ready.Errata:
If the crew is sunk during the boarding, they have the skeletal trait, and would adhere to any skeletal rules (such as going to the discard pile). This includes any abilities (i.e. Iken of Venderheim (exp)).
You may pay extra costs associated with hiring that crew (i.e. Talia del Emelia) which may give them additional abilities.

Uppmann's Coat.Name: Uppmann's Coat
Uppmann's Coat.Text:
The cost of this card is reduced by 3 if being attached to a Rilasciare Crew.
Act: Tack this card and discard a card from your hand to search your deck for a card with the Item trait. Reveal the card to your opponent(s), shuffle your deck, and place the card on top of your deck.
Uppmann's Coat.Flavor Text: "Lockpics in the collar, holsters in the sleeves… everything a wanted criminal would need."

Uprising!.Name: Uprising!
Uprising!.Text: Target a Ship in this Sea. That Ship suffers 1 Hit for each untacked Villainous Crew card on board plus 2 Hits for each untacked Captive Crew card on board.
Uprising!.Flavor Text: "Sometimes, the velvet glove is preferable to the iron fist." - Enrique Orduño

Uriah the Dribbler.Name: Uriah the Dribbler
Uriah the Dribbler.Flavor Text: A former associate of Foul Weather Jack, it was Uriah who first told his master about the Spear of the West Wind... and what they could do once they harnessed it.

Ursula von Stahl.Name: Ursula von Stahl
Ursula von Stahl.Text: Act: Pay 3 Influence and tack Ursula to target another player's Ship in this Sea. That player must discard one of their non-Captain Crew. If that player does not have a non-CaptainCrew with an influence cost less than 3, this ability has no effect.
Ursula von Stahl.Flavor Text: "Don't mind the gun, it' not loaded. Really

Ussuran Alliance.Name: Ussuran Alliance
Ussuran Alliance.Text:
You may only play this card while your Ship is in The Mirror. You must discard 3 Goods Attachments to put this card into play. Your Captain is considered to have the Ussuran symbol. Any player may discard this card as an Action by discarding 3 of their completed Adventures while in this Sea.
Act: Tack this card to search your deck for a Henchmen Attachment or Adventure. Put that card into your hand then shuffle your deck.
Ussuran Alliance.Flavor Text: With Allende missing, the Ussurans have gone looking for new allies on the seven seas.

Ussuran Brawl.Name: Ussuran Brawl
Ussuran Brawl.Text: +2 Swashbuckling. This crew inflicts 2 extra Hits during Boarding Attacks.
Ussuran Brawl.Flavor Text: "Lock up the china, Fergus - Vlad and Piotr are at it again!"

Ussuran Intrigue.Name: Ussuran Intrigue
Ussuran Intrigue.Flavor Text: "Captain Allende has been helpful to us in the past. Perhaps he can be helpful again." - Lady Ketheryna

Ussuran Madhouse.Name: Ussuran Madhouse
Ussuran Madhouse.Text:
Act: Target a non-Captain Crew in this Sea. If that Crew's Influence cost is less than the number of Attachments that Crew has attached, that Crew is tacked.
Act: Each player shuffles their deck and discard pile together. You may draw 2 cards from your deck; all other players draw 1 card from their deck.
Ussuran Madhouse.Flavor Text: "What happened to you, Felipe?" she whispered. "The witches took me," he replied, "and gave me the vision of the 7th Sea."

Ussuran Pelts.Name: Ussuran Pelts
Ussuran Pelts.Trait: 1 Sea Away - Goods Adventure - Crew Attachment
Ussuran Pelts.Flavor Text: We don't know who skinned 'em and we don't care... even if there are twelve foot bears showin' up in e'ery port we dock.

Ussuran Whalers.Name: Ussuran Whalers
Ussuran Whalers.Text: When this Crew tacks to absorb hits from a Monster card, Weather card, or Sea Attachment, they absorb 3 extra hits.
Ussuran Whalers.Flavor Text: “Aye, aye, Cap’n Ivanovitch. We’ll gut and stuff that overgrown cod. But, umm, how big did you say it was?”

Val Mokk.Name: Val Mokk
Val Mokk.Text: React: Tack Val when you are paying the cost to discard another player's Control Card. That cost is reduced by 3 (minimum 0).
Val Mokk.Flavor Text: "You've done well enough, Mr. Guttormson, but the Revenjs is still afloat. I'm giving you one more chance to sink her for good…"

Valentina Villanova.Name: Valentina Villanova
Valentina Villanova.Text: Act: Tack and sink one of your Crew to draw 2 cards from your deck.
Valentina Villanova.Flavor Text: “Our only choice was to fight free. That is still the only destiny I see for us.”

Valery Allamand.Name: Valery Allamand
Valery Allamand.Text: When this Crew tacks to absorb Hits, he absorbs 2 extra Hit. This Crew has +1 Adventuring for each Item card attached.
Valery Allamand.Flavor Text: "This will work - all we need is a big crank…"

Valgard Skaardalneir.Name: Valgard Skaardalneir
Valgard Skaardalneir.Text: When hiring Valgard, you may pay an additional 3 Influence to give him the trait: Lærdom 1 and +2 Influence until the end of the game
Valgard Skaardalneir.Flavor Text: "If Valhalla approaches, meet it with open arms."

Valkyries.Name: Valkyries
Valkyries.Text: When Valkyries tack to absorb hits, they absorb 2 extra Hits. Valkyries inflict 1 extra hit during Boarding Attacks.
Valkyries.Flavor Text: "For Vestenmannavnjar! For the glory of our ancestors!"

Valoix's Crime.Name: Valoix's Crime
Valoix's Crime.Text: Any player may sink this chantey by paying 3 Influence as an Action. All Captains have the following trait: While you are in your Starting Sea, opponents may not begin a Boarding with your Ship without a card effect.

Valoix's Folly.Name: Valoix's Folly
Valoix's Folly.Text:
Act: Target a Ship in this Sea with a tacked Montaigne Captain on board. Inflict 4 hits on that Ship.
Act: Tack one of your Crew to draw 1 card from your Deck.
Valoix's Folly.Flavor Text: "I don't care who he inspired to desert. You shall take no Action against the General," Rosamonde sniffed. "He still has my favor... and I am still far closer to l'Empereur than you."

Valor and Heroism.Name: Valor and Heroism
Valor and Heroism.Text:
You may not play this card if you have a Villainous Captain or if you have a Control Card in play.
Act: Tack your Captain and Ship to put a Control Attachment into play from your hand without paying its skill cost.
Valor and Heroism.Flavor Text: Allende and his men celebrated his return by robbing every ship they saw on the way back to La Bucca.

Valor's Cove.Name: Valor's Cove
Valor's Cove.Text: Act: Tack your Captain and sink this card. Search your discard pile or sunk pile for any one card. Place that card in your hand.
Valor's Cove.Flavor Text: A lot more than bodies wash up on the beach.

Valroux School.Name: Valroux School
Valroux School.Text: React: Tack Valroux School to draw two cards after this Crew plays a Thrust Boarding Attack.
Valroux School.Flavor Text: "You're slow and sloppy, like all your kind. A pity I can't teach you how true men fight."

Velda Conklin.Name: Velda Conklin
Velda Conklin.Text: When Velda tacks to absorb Hits, she absorbs 2 extra Hits, except during Boarding.
Velda Conklin.Flavor Text: "The Vendel aren't thieves or butchers, despite what the Vestenmannavnjar think. All the same, a long trip far away from them sound perfect to me."

Velik.Name: Velik
Velik.Text: React: Tack when a card with the Weather trait is targeting any of your cards. That action is canceled.
Velik.Flavor Text: No magic, my Captain. Just a little miracle. Glad you appreciate it.

Velik - Exp..Name: Velik - Exp.
Velik - Exp..Text: React: If this Crew is untacked and his Adventuring skill is greater than 2, you may discard 1 card from your hand when you are paying an Adventuring cost to produce 2 Adventuring. Reduce this Crew's Adventuring by 3 until the end of the turn.
Velik - Exp..Errata: Nation added. Texte modified from React: If Velik is untacked and his Adventuring skill is greater than 2, you may discard 1 card from your hand when you are paying an Adventuring cost to produce 2 Adventuring. Reduce Velik's Adventuring by 3 until end of turn. to React: If this Crew is untacked and his Adventuring skill is greater than 2, you may discard 1 card from your hand when you are paying an Adventuring cost to produce 2 Adventuring. Reduce this Crew's Adventuring by 3 until the end of the turn.

Vendel Smugglers.Name: Vendel Smugglers
Vendel Smugglers.Text:
When this card is put into play, it attaches to the Frothing Sea.
Act: Tack this card to attach it to an adjacent Sea.
React: Tack this card while it is in the Forbidden Sea and you are paying an Influence cost. This card produces 4 Influence then attaches to the Frothing Sea.
Vendel Smugglers.Flavor Text: "Are you calling the tarp a liar?"

Vendel Sorcery.Name: Vendel Sorcery
Vendel Sorcery.Text: The Skill costs of Weather cards are reduced by 2 (minimum 0).
Vendel Sorcery.Flavor Text: The Vendel practice Lærdom sorcery as well, having stolen it from their Vesten brothers. It is no less powerful coming from a merchant than from a warrior.

Vengeance of the Damned.Name: Vengeance of the Damned
Vengeance of the Damned.Text: Target a Ship in the same Sea as an uncompleted Artifact Adventure. Inflict 3 Hits on that Ship.
Vengeance of the Damned.Flavor Text: "You don't understand! The captain of the Black freighter - I was the one who killed him..." - Philip Gosse

Vengeful Serpent.Name: Vengeful Serpent
Vengeful Serpent.Text:
Any player in this Sea may sink Serpent by tacking 8 Swashbuckling as an action.
Act: Tack Serpent to attach it to an adjacent Sea.
Act: Tack Serpent to target a Ship in this Sea. Serpent inflicts 5 Hits on that Ship.

Very Minor Damage.Name: Very Minor Damage
Very Minor Damage.Text:
React: Play this card when you are inflicting Hits on another player with a Ship in this Sea. That player may not attach Damage Attachments to their Ship to absorb Hits until the end of the turn.
React: Play when another player is playing a card that will become a Damage Attachment. Cancel the effects of that card. Sink the canceled card.
Very Minor Damage.Flavor Text: The Roost struck the island shore, guided by Lucrezia's hand. "Time to go," she waved cheerily.

Vesten Figurehead.Name: Vesten Figurehead
Vesten Figurehead.Text: Act: Tack the Vesten Figurehead while you have 3 or more completed Adventures in play to target another Ship in this Sea. You inflict a 2 Hit Cannon Attack on that Ship.

Vesten Figurehead - Foil.Name: Vesten Figurehead - Foil
Vesten Figurehead - Foil.Text: Act: Tack the Vesten Figurehead while you have 3 or more completed Adventures in play to target another Ship in this Sea. You inflict a 2 Hit Cannon Attack on that Ship.

Vesten Pride.Name: Vesten Pride
Vesten Pride.Text: Until the end of the turn, your Vesten Crew inflict 1 extra Hit during Boarding Attacks. If there is another Vesten Ship in play, then until the end of the turn your Vesten Crew inflict 1 extra Hit during Boarding Attacks (2 extra Hits total).

Vestenmannavnjar Archers.Name: Vestenmannavnjar Archers
Vestenmannavnjar Archers.Text: Act: Tack the Archers and pay your Ship's move cost to inflict a 3 Hit Cannon attack on an opposing Ship in this Sea.
Vestenmannavnjar Archers.Flavor Text: The arrows streaked across the water like comets, igniting everything they touched.

Vestenmannavnjar Funeral.Name: Vestenmannavnjar Funeral
Vestenmannavnjar Funeral.Text: React: Play when one of your Vesten Crew sinks to absorb Hits. This card attaches to your Captain. All of your Vesten Crew inflict 1 extra Hit during Boarding Attacks. Only one Vestenmannavnjar Funeral may be played per Crew that sinks.
Vestenmannavnjar Funeral.Flavor Text: The Revenjs had escaped Jorund's betrayal - but Iken had paid the price.

Victor of Luthon.Name: Victor of Luthon
Victor of Luthon.Text: All Cannon Attacks and Boarding Attacks inflict 1 extra Hit.
Victor of Luthon.Flavor Text: He was the most notorious killer in Avalon's history: The Unseelie would have claimed him if the noose hadn't first.

Victory for the Bold.Name: Victory for the Bold
Victory for the Bold.Text: React: Play this card when you complete an Adventure if there is another Ship in this Sea. Move your Ship to an adjacent Sea.
Victory for the Bold.Flavor Text: "If any wish to ally themselves with Vendel gold, we'll have to show them the price of their vanity..."

Vile Duel.Name: Vile Duel
Vile Duel.Text: Tack one of your Villainous Crew, to target a Heroic Crew (except Captain) on another Ship. Play a card from your hand as a Boarding attack to begin a Duel between the two crew.

Vile Temple.Name: Vile Temple
Vile Temple.Text: Any player in this Sea may sink this card by producing 5 Swashbuckling or Cannon as an action. When Heroic crew tack to produce skill points, they produce 1 fewer point (minimum 0. Crew with a 0 skill still produce 0).

Villskap (Fury).Name: Villskap (Fury)
Villskap (Fury).Text: Act: Tack this card and pay 1 Adventuring to target a Ship in this Sea. Inflict 2 Hits on that Ship.

Vincent Rochester.Name: Vincent Rochester
Vincent Rochester.Flavor Text: "Get back to work an' keep yur hands out o' the powder!"

Vincenzo Caligari.Name: Vincenzo Caligari
Vincenzo Caligari.Trait: Crimson Roger Captain Attachment - Unique - Patron
Vincenzo Caligari.Text: React: Tack Vincenzo when you are paying an Adventuring cost to produce 3 Adventuring.
Vincenzo Caligari.Flavor Text: "Very impressive, Captain Reis, but not the piece I'm looking for. Still, it's worth a little recompense..."

Vincenzo de Tonelli.Name: Vincenzo de Tonelli
Vincenzo de Tonelli.Text: Act: Once per turn, tack one of your Patron Attachments to untack this Crew.
Vincenzo de Tonelli.Flavor Text: "I'm an old friend of Julius's, captain. His uncle thought it prudent to have someone looking out for him - so you don't have to, of course."

Vipera ex Morsi Swordsman School.Name: Vipera ex Morsi Swordsman School
Vipera ex Morsi Swordsman School.Text:
The cost of this Attachment is reduced by 3 if being attached to a Rilasciare Crew.
React: Tack this Crew instead of performing a Boarding Attack to target a non-Captain Crew on the other Ship with an Influence cost less than this Crew's Influence cost. Inflict Hits on the other Ship equal to the target Crew's Swashbuckling plus 3.
Vipera ex Morsi Swordsman School.Flavor Text: The key is knowing when to strike.

Visions of the Isle.Name: Visions of the  Isle
Visions of the Isle.Text: All Captains have the following ability: Act: Once per turn, discard 4 cards from your hand to draw 3 cards from your Deck.
Visions of the Isle.Flavor Text: Derwyddon rose from his sheets as sweat coated his brow. "The  Island," he whispered. "The gateway will open..."

Vivianne Étalon du Toille.Name: Vivianne Étalon du Toille
Vivianne Étalon du Toille.Text: If Vivianne's opponent in a Boarding Attacks is Holy, Vivianne's Boarding Attack inflicts 2 extra Hits.
Vivianne Étalon du Toille.Flavor Text: "I love my country, as the Castillians love theirs. We shall see whose love proves stronger."

Vodacce Alliance.Name: Vodacce Alliance
Vodacce Alliance.Text:
You may only play this card while your Ship is in the Forbidden Sea. You must discard 2 completed Artifact Adventures to put this card into play. Your Captain is considered to have the Vodacce symbol. Any player may discard this card as an Action by discarding 3 of their completed Adventures while in this Sea.
Act: Tack this card to search your deck for a Prize Adventure. Reveal that card to all players, add it to your hand, then shuffle your deck.
Vodacce Alliance.Flavor Text: The Crimson Rogers have found other buyers for the artifacts they seize.

Vodacce Pirates.Name: Vodacce Pirates
Vodacce Pirates.Text:
You must be in the Forbidden Sea to play this card.Any player in this Sea may discard this card by producing 12 Influence as an action. Card effects which discard or sink Sea Attachments may not target this card.
Act: Tack this card to get a Control card from your deck, show it to your opponents and put it in your hand. Shuffle your deck.

Vodacce Valuables.Name: Vodacce Valuables
Vodacce Valuables.Flavor Text: "So I said to Jones, 'Why split it two ways, when one will do?' and pulled the trigger. Poor old gullible Jones. He actually thought I meant to share."

Vodanken.Name: Vodanken
Vodanken.Text: Target a Ship. That Ship suffers 6 Hits.
Vodanken.Flavor Text: "If that's Matushka's steed, I'd hate to see Matushka." - The General

Vodanken's Breath.Name: Vodanken's Breath
Vodanken's Breath.Text: Target a Sea. Until the end of this turn, Ships suffer 3 Hits when they enter that Sea. Ships may avoid suffering these Hits by paying Sailing equal to their move cost.

Voices of the Dead.Name: Voices of the Dead
Voices of the Dead.Text: Act: Play when you are paying the cost to attach, discard or sink a Control card. Tack one of your Sorcerers to reduce the cost by the number of Sorcery Knacks that Crew has attached.
Voices of the Dead.Flavor Text: "You must save them, my love. Save as many as you can. Ragnarok approaches and our people must be ready..." - Red Thorfild

Volta.Name: Volta
Volta.Text: Volta's Boarding Attacks that finish with a Slash inflict 2 extra Hits.
Volta.Flavor Text: Even though his tongue's been cut out, Smitts swears he heard him talking in his sleep.

Volta - Exp..Name: Volta - Exp.
Volta - Exp..Text: React: Tack your Captain when another Ship begins a Boarding with your Ship to cancel the Boarding. The attempting player must target one of their Crew. Play a card from your hand as a Boarding attack to begin a Duel between Volta and the targeted Crew.
Volta - Exp..Flavor Text: "Soon, my friend, very soon…" - Riant Gaucher

Wake of Estallio.Name: Wake of Estallio
Wake of Estallio.Text: Target a Ship in la Boca. Move that Ship to either Frothing Sea or Forbidden Sea.
Wake of Estallio.Flavor Text: It flashed past them like liquid thunder. As the ship rocked in its wake, the beast waited eagerly for the sailors to fall overboard.

Ward of the Albatross.Name: Ward of the Albatross
Ward of the Albatross.Text:
Act: Discard this card when you have no cards in your hand to draw five cards from your deck.
React: Discard this card when you tack a Crew, and you have no other Crew untacked, to untack your Captain.
React: After another player has tacked a Crew to produce Cannon, tack this card to reduce the amount of Cannon produced to 0.

Warren Abbotsford.Name: Warren Abbotsford
Warren Abbotsford.Text: Act: Tack to inflict 3 Hits on a Ship in this Sea. Discard the top card of your deck - Warren is sunk if the Boarding Attack on the discard is a Punch.
Warren Abbotsford.Flavor Text: "You never know what you're gonna find in those ruins. Look at these humming marbles, for... oops."

Warship.Name: Warship
Warship.Text:
Any player in this Sea may sink Warship by tacking 6 Cannon as an action.
Act: Tack Warship to attach it to a Sea adjacent to this Sea.
Act: Tack Warship to target a Ship in this Sea. Warship inflicts a 4 Hit Cannon Attack on that Ship.
Warship.Flavor Text: "The Castillian blockade can spare a ship - and I need a fox-hound to drive Allende to me." - The General

Waylaid.Name: Waylaid
Waylaid.Text:
Any player in this Sea may sink Waylaid by tacking 3 Cannon as an action.
Act: Tack this card and target a Ship in this Sea to inflict a 2 Hit Cannon Attack on that Ship.
Waylaid.Flavor Text: "This bay looks safe." - Simon the bosun

We Needs Us An Ussuran Gunner.Name: We Needs Us An Ussuran Gunner

We'll Get Him Back!.Name: We'll Get Him Back!
We'll Get Him Back!.Text:
While attached to a Sea your hand size is reduced by 1.
React: Tack this card and attach it to your Captain after you have hired a Crew with a printed Influence cost greater than 6. While  attached to your Captain, you draw 1 extra card between rounds of a Boarding.
We'll Get Him Back!.Flavor Text: "All we have to do is find him." - Berek

Wearing the Black Ring.Name: Wearing the Black Ring
Wearing the Black Ring.Trait: 1 Sea Away - Hand - Kreuzritter Crew Attachment
Wearing the Black Ring.Text: React: Tack this card when another player targets this Crew with an action or effect to cancel that action or effect.

Wee Willy.Name: Wee Willy
Wee Willy.Text: React: When Wee Willy tacks to conduct a Cannon Attack, discard the top card of your deck. If the Boarding Attack on the discard is a Slash, this Cannon Attack inflicts 3 extra Hits.
Wee Willy.Flavor Text: "Are you sure that's gonna fit in the cannon?" "Trust me. Just cover your eyes when we fire it."

Well of Purity.Name: Well of Purity
Well of Purity.Text: Your Heroic Crew inflict 2 extra Hits during Boarding Attacks if the opposing Captain in the Boarding is Villainous.
Well of Purity.Flavor Text: If true evil exists, then it must be balanced by an equal amount of true good.

Well Stocked Armory.Name: Well Stocked Armory
Well Stocked Armory.Text: The Armory counts as one Crew against your crew maximum. Your Boarding Attacks inflict 1 extra Hit.
Well Stocked Armory.Flavor Text: Place a sword in every hand and your enemies will fear to sleep. - Crescent proverb.

Well-Equipped Sick Bay.Name: Well-Equipped Sick Bay
Well-Equipped Sick Bay.Text: The Sick Bay counts as one Crew against your crew maximum. All of your Crew absorb 2 extra Hits when they sink to absorb Hits.
Well-Equipped Sick Bay.Flavor Text: "Why would he save me like that? He never even liked me," whispered the General. "Because you are the Captain, monsieur. It was his duty."

Wenching.Name: Wenching
Wenching.Text: Target any one of your Crew, except your Captain. That Crew is untacked.
Wenching.Flavor Text: "Another pint o'er here, lass. The mug can rest on the table and ye can rest here on me lap."

Wenching Jim.Name: Wenching Jim
Wenching Jim.Text: Act: Tack Jim and pay 4 Influence to target a Ship in this Sea. That Ship's controller must target one of their Crew. Play a card from your hand as a Boarding Attack to begin a Duel between the target Crew and Jim.

Whalers.Name: Whalers
Whalers.Text: When this Crew pays Cannon or Swashbuckling to discard a Sea Attachment, that Sea Attachment is sunk instead.
Whalers.Flavor Text: "You lot ever killed a leviathan before?"

What Do We Have Here? - Foil.Name: What Do We Have Here? - Foil
What Do We Have Here? - Foil.Text: Draw the next 3 cards from your deck. You may attach any Adventure cards drawn to Seas they can be legally placed in. Discard all of these cards which you do not put into play.
What Do We Have Here? - Foil.Flavor Text: Berek was going to set course for somewhere big. Then the Crimson Rogers showed up.

What Does Not Kill Us.Name: What Does Not Kill Us
What Does Not Kill Us.Text: All completed Adventures that provide printed Skill bonuses of +4 or more provide an additional +2 to the appropriate Skill(s).
What Does Not Kill Us.Flavor Text: Red howled as the metal glowed white hot. "You cannot imagine how much I am willing to endure."

Whatever the Cost.Name: Whatever the Cost
Whatever the Cost.Text:
Any player may pay the cancel cost of this action.
Act: Untack your Captain. When paying for this action, you may sink one of your Oath cards instead of paying the skill cost.
Whatever the Cost.Flavor Text: "Do you swear?" His hand bled freely. "I swear. Upon my blood, I swear."

When All Else Fails.Name: When All Else Fails
When All Else Fails.Text: Target a Sea Attachment. That Attachment is discarded.
When All Else Fails.Flavor Text: "When all else fails, take a hostage. Their guns get quiet when one of their own is tied to the figurehead." - J. Berek

Whites of Their Eyes.Name: Whites of Their Eyes
Whites of Their Eyes.Text: React: Play when an opponent attempts a Boarding with your Ship. The Boarding is canceled.
Whites of Their Eyes.Flavor Text: "By all means, board me if you wish. Shall I tell you about the last man who did?" - Reis

Who Can You Trust?.Name: Who Can You Trust?
Who Can You Trust?.Text: Target a Ship. That Ship suffer 1 Hit for each Villainous Crew card on board.
Who Can You Trust?.Flavor Text: You can't trust the weather, You can't trust the sea, Who can you trust, my brother If you can't trust me? - "The Treacherous Sailor"

Who Shot the Albatross?.Name: Who Shot the Albatross?
Who Shot the Albatross?.Text: Any player in this Sea may sink Who Shot the Albatross by tacking 1 Swashbuckling as an action. While Who Shot the Albatross is attached to your Ship, you have +5 Sailing for the purposes of determining Initiative.
Who Shot the Albatross?.Flavor Text: "Yes, sir. I seen who done it. It was... hey, where'd he go?"

Wild Party!.Name: Wild Party!
Wild Party!.Text: You may only play this card if you have a Gosse Captain. The Actions phase ends. Play proceeds to the Draw phase. Sink this card.
Wild Party!.Flavor Text: "Just make sure the chair doesn't damage his sword arm, lad." - Philip Gosse

Wilhelm Dünst.Name: Wilhelm Dünst
Wilhelm Dünst.Text: Wilhelm has +2 Swashbuckling while performing a Boarding Attack if the opposing Captain is Villainous.
Wilhelm Dünst.Flavor Text: "Don't tell me how to fight. I've killed more men than you have thoughts in your little head."

Wilhelm Dunst - Exp..Name: Wilhelm Dunst - Exp.
Wilhelm Dunst - Exp..Text: React: Tack Wilhelm instead of performing a Boarding Attack to target a Sorcerer or Villainous Crew on the other Ship. That player must sink the target or suffer 6 Hits.
Wilhelm Dunst - Exp..Flavor Text: "War never ends. So too shall it be with my vigilance."

William Fodd.Name: William Fodd
William Fodd.Text: When William tacks to absorb Hits from a Cannon Attack, he absorbs 2 extra Hits.
William Fodd.Flavor Text: "I ne'er seen anything like it. The cannon shot flies by his head and he just don't seem to notice."

William Highport.Name: William Highport
William Highport.Text:
This Crew may not be placed on a Villainous Captain's Ship, unless that Captain is a Gosse Captain.
Act: Once per turn, target one of this Crew's skills. This Crew gains +3 to that skill for the remainder of the turn.
William Highport.Flavor Text: "Righteous men don't need a seal to proclaim their worth. Gosse was never a Knight, after all."
William Highport.Errata: Secret Society Knights of the Rose and Cross added. Can now be placed on a Villainous Captain's Ship if this Captain is Gosse. Flavor text modified.
William Highport.Changes on MRP: Affiliation/Nation modified;Text modified;Flavor text modified;Artist modified;

William Toss.Name: William Toss
William Toss.Flavor Text: I looked at the double-headed coin and smiled. "Heads, of course." It landed in his hands and we both looked. "Sorry, pal. I'll take that purse now."

William Toss - Exp..Name: William Toss - Exp.
William Toss - Exp..Flavor Text: His luck ran out at the same time Berek's did, only no one came to pull poor William from the sea.

Willie Wilcox.Name: Willie Wilcox
Willie Wilcox.Text: Willie inflicts 2 extra Hits during Boarding Attacks.
Willie Wilcox.Flavor Text: "He's tougher than those bergs out there, and he'll bash anyone who lays a finger on his brother." - Thom Brunner

Willie Wilcox - Exp..Name: Willie Wilcox - Exp.
Willie Wilcox - Exp..Text:
Willie is considered to have a Hand Attachment.
Act: Tack and sink one of your Crew to untack Willie.
Willie Wilcox - Exp..Flavor Text: The witches' shears took his hand, but Lucrezia had a replacement...

Willowed Ropes.Name: Willowed Ropes
Willowed Ropes.Text: All of your Crew inflict one extra Hit during Boarding Attacks.
Willowed Ropes.Flavor Text: Allende got'em from some Vestenmannavnjar raiders a few weeks ago and they work like magic.

Wind at Your Back.Name: Wind at Your Back
Wind at Your Back.Flavor Text: "The old man claimed he could taste the wind. Sounds like that rune nonsense to me." - Bjørn Brind

Winds of Fate.Name: Winds of Fate
Winds of Fate.Flavor Text: "West," the fate witch whispered. "We are meant to go west." The Captain nodded. "Right," he said, not even bothering to ask her why.

With Your Best Men About You.Name: With Your Best Men About You
With Your Best Men About You.Text: Any player may sink this Chantey as an Action by tacking their Captain. All Crew with an influence cost of 3 or more in play with the Loyal trait gain +1 to all of their non-zero skills.
With Your Best Men About You.Flavor Text: With so many heading west, those who remain gather their most loyal men.

Without a Trace.Name: Without a Trace
Without a Trace.Text: Target and sink an Ally with a skill cost less than 5.
Without a Trace.Flavor Text: "It was just a short row across the reach. How could he have vanished without a trace?" - Rosamonde du Montaigne

Worthless Trinket.Name: Worthless Trinket
Worthless Trinket.Text: You may not play this card if you have a Villainous Captain. Discard one of your Item or Goods Attachments to draw 2 cards.
Worthless Trinket.Flavor Text: "We need money for supplies. Tell them it's a priceless Syrneth artifact, and don't settle for less than 1,000 guilders." - Guy McCormick

Would-Be Adventurers.Name: Would-Be Adventurers
Would-Be Adventurers.Text:
React: Play when you are producing Adventuring. Suffer 3 Hits to produce 2 Adventuring.
React: Target another player's non-Captain Crew in this Sea after it has tacked to produce Adventuring. Untack the target Crew. Push one of your Crew forward and play a Boarding Attack from your hand to begin a Duel between your Crew and the targeted Crew.

Would-Be Gunners.Name: Would-Be Gunners
Would-Be Gunners.Text:
React: Play when you are producing Cannon. Suffer 3 Hits to produce 2 Cannon.
React: Target another player's non-Captain Crew in this Sea after it has tacked to produce Cannon. Untack the target Crew. Push one of your Crew forward and play a Boarding Attack from your hand to begin a Duel between your Crew and the targeted Crew.
Would-Be Gunners.Flavor Text: "Would someone please tell them they're pointing at their own mast?"

Would-Be Traders.Name: Would-Be Traders
Would-Be Traders.Text:
React: Play when you are producing Influence. Suffer 3 Hits to produce 2 Influence.
React: Target another player's non-Captain Crew in this Sea after it has tacked to produce Influence. Untack the target Crew. Push one of your Crew forward and play a Boarding Attack from your hand to begin a Duel between your Crew and the targeted Crew.
Would-Be Traders.Flavor Text: "Say what you like about Fox, but the man could sell snow to a Vesten." - Celedoine

Wounded.Name: Wounded
Wounded.Text: React: Play when you are tacking a Crew to absorb hits. That Crew absorbs 3 extra hits, and this card attaches to the Crew. This Crew may not untack while Wounded is attached - discard Wounded instead.

Wreckers.Name: Wreckers
Wreckers.Flavor Text: "Thank the Prophets for that lighthouse," muttered Simon the bosun. Just then, it winked out, leaving us at the mercy of the rocks.

Yannick le Geant.Name: Yannick le Geant
Yannick le Geant.Text: When this Crew tacks to absorb hits, he absorbs extra hits equal to the number of Crew cards in your sunk pile.
Yannick le Geant.Flavor Text: “Pardon me, did you need any assistance? I’d hate to intrude.”

Yngvild Olafssdottir.Name: Yngvild Olafssdottir
Yngvild Olafssdottir.Trait: Start: Trade Sea - Heroic - Lærdom 1 - Swordsman +2
Yngvild Olafssdottir.Text: While you have three or more other Vesten Crew on your Ship, your cost to put Weather cards into play is reduced by 3 (minimum 1).

Yngvild Olafssdottir - Foil.Name: Yngvild Olafssdottir - Foil
Yngvild Olafssdottir - Foil.Trait: Start: Trade Sea - Heroic - Lærdom 1 - Swordsman +2
Yngvild Olafssdottir - Foil.Text: While you have three or more other Vesten Crew on your Ship, your cost to put Weather cards into play is reduced by 3 (minimum 1).

Yngvild's Axe.Name: Yngvild's Axe
Yngvild's Axe.Trait: Vesten Captain Attachment - Unique - Signature Item
Yngvild's Axe.Text:
Act: Sink this card to untack your Captain.
Act: Tack this card to target one of your other Vesten Crew to give that Crew +2 to all of that Crew's skills that are greater than 1.
React: Tack this card when you are paying a Swashbuckling cost for an action to play, discard or sink a Control card to give your Captain +4 Swashbuckling until after the action.

Yngvild's Plan.Name: Yngvild's Plan
Yngvild's Plan.Text: Any player may sink this Chantey by paying 3 Adventuring as an Action. All Captains have the Villainous trait.
Yngvild's Plan.Flavor Text: "In the middle of the Mirror, a gate will rise," the King said quietly. "If you can open it, you will unleash the hordes of Valhalla upon your enemies."

Young Samuel Gosse.Name: Young Samuel Gosse
Young Samuel Gosse.Text: If Melinda Gosse or Captain Red is your Captain, this Crew does not count towards your Crew Maximum.
Young Samuel Gosse.Flavor Text: “Uncle Phil wouldn’t let me go with him. You can’t afford to be so choosy with so many berths to fill, Melinda.”

Your Word is Your Bond.Name: Your Word is Your Bond
Your Word is Your Bond.Text:
Act: Target a Captain controlled by a player with an Oath card in play. Tack one of your Crew to tack the target Captain.
Act: If you have an Oath card in play, all of your Captain's skills are increased by 1 until the end of the turn.
Your Word is Your Bond.Flavor Text: "We swore an oath, my friend.You will uphold it, or I'll send you to St. Rose's grave."

Yr Hägin Brønsson.Name: Yr Hägin Brønsson
Yr Hägin Brønsson.Text: React: Once per turn, target a player drawing one or more cards during the Actions phase other than during a Boarding. Inflict a number of Hits on that player equal to the number of cards drawn.
Yr Hägin Brønsson.Flavor Text: "The serpent feeds upon itself, the circle continues on. Endings and beginnings are often one and the same."
Yr Hägin Brønsson.Errata: Precision: Can be used if the opponent draw at least one card, not only multiple cards.Flavor text modified.

Ysabette du Montaigne.Name: Ysabette du Montaigne
Ysabette du Montaigne.Text: Act: Once per turn, discard a card from your hand to look at the top five cards of your deck. You may either discard those five cards or return them to the top of your deck in any order. You may only use this ability if you have 4 or more other Montaigne Crew on board.
Ysabette du Montaigne.Flavor Text: "I'd rather be a pirate than a princess. You're allowed to dress yourself, for starters."

Zoya the Serpent.Name: Zoya the Serpent
Zoya the Serpent.Flavor Text: He claims to wear the skin of a Crescent cobra, though no one has ever seen him use it. Most are too fearful to ask.
